column2: Nisum is a leading global digital commerce firm headquartered in California,  with services spanning digital strategy and transformation,  insights and analytics,  blockchain,  business agility,  and custom software development.  Founded in 2000 with the customer-centric motto     Building Success Together     ,   Nisum has grown to over 1, 800 professionals across the United States,  Chile, Colombia,  India,  Pakistan and Canada.  A preferred advisor to leading Fortune 500 brands,  Nisum enables clients to achieve direct business growth by building the advanced technology they need to reach end customers in today s world,  with immersive and seamless experiences across digital and physical channels.          What You`ll Do       Design and Develop automation infrastructure that helps qualify products in areas not limiting to Functional,  Performance and Security.     Design & build automated regression tests from test cases using Cucumber framework or similar test frameworks.     Plan and run automation tests,  integration tests,  & regression tests    Comfortable communicating with developers & other technical team members    Participates in the full SDLC/Agile cycle engagements,  including meetings,  iterative development,  estimations and design sessions    Perform UAT / regression testing against APIs,  Web Services using internal and external tools,  Web portals and reports    Perform UAT / regression testing for iOS and Android on emulators and hardware devices    Identify and report QA issues,  workflow issues and other project risks to development team    Evaluate system performance,  reproduce issues and work with development to resolve identified problems    Tasks include evaluating daily test suites results,  maintaining/updating automation tests,  and improving regression tests/framework    Review logs (via SPLUNK) and data analytics for the application    Analyze live and historic data stored in DynamoDB,  AWS RedShift,  Aurora databases    Ability to perform root cause analysis (RCA) across SDLC phases - Application layer,  Database layer,     Web Services,  UI (Front End),  and wherever applicable                     What You Know       A minimum of 8+ years for experience in product quality with automation as primary focus.     Hands-on automation framework development experience.     Experience in scripting/programming languages like JAVA,  Python.     Experience in testing enterprise level web applications,  web services,  databases.     Strong analytical skills to differentiate issue whether it s FrontEnd or BackEnd issue    Strong experience in testing API calls from FrontEnd    Experience working with automation testing frameworks and developing testing scripts    Working knowledge of SQL,  DynamoDB,  AuroraDB,  AWS RedShift,  Splunk,  Raw data within text,  . csv,  . xls/. xlsx,  JSON,  XML files,  Jmeter,  Charles Proxy,  Postman    Ability to work with browser developer tools e. g.  Chrome developer tools (Console,  Network,  Session Storage,  etc. )    Experience with Agile testing practices,  SDLC process,  Business Intelligence processes,  Business Operations,  Data Analytics    Understands deployment pipeline,  continuous integration,  and code coverage.                Education       Bachelor's degree in a related field.                Benefits       In addition to competitive salaries and benefits packages,  Nisum India offers its employees some unique and fun extras:      Continuous Learning -   Year-round training sessions are offered as part of skill enhancement certifications sponsored by the company on a need basis.  We support our team to excel in their field.       Parental Medical Insurance   - Nisum believes our team is the heart of our business and we want to make sure to take care of the heart of theirs.  We offer opt-in parental medical insurance in addition to our medical benefits.       Activities -  From the Nisum Premier League's cricket tournaments to hosted Hack-a-thon,  Nisum employees can participate in a variety of team-building activities such as skits,  and dances performance in addition to festival celebrations.       Free Meals -   Free snacks and dinner is provided on a daily basis,  in addition to subsidized lunch.                 Nisum is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

column2: Leapwork has created the worlds most accessible automation platform. Through a visual, no-code approach, Leapwork makes it easy for business and IT users to automate repetitive processes, so enterprises can adopt and scale automation faster. Leapwork is used by more than 400 global enterprises across all industries, from banks and insurance companies to life science, government, and aerospace.  We are headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, and has local offices across Europe, the US and Asia. Who are we looking for? We are looking for a high-energy professional individual contributor, who loves to engage with clients to drive innovation in their organization. Being customer-oriented in this role means understanding the client?? requirements by asking relevant questions, listening to them, spending time with them in their working environment, and with members of their team. It is often required for you to integrate yourself within their internal team so you should be flexible in your approach.  The role requires that you are analytical, can attune to a client?? needs, can quickly understand their business processes, and translate them into an automation context. Experience & Qualification: 4 -9 years of total experience in QA (Quality Assurance) of Web/Desktop/Mobile/App/etc 3 -7 years in any one of the automation tools - Selenium Web Driver / VSTS / UFT /Tosca / Any RPA tool Good working knowledge of at least one programming knowledge - C#/Java/Python and/or OOP?? Experience in creating Automation Frameworks, test automation strategy, automation effort estimations, and test automation prioritization. Experienced with agile, DevOps processes, source control, database, and CI/CD implementation. Having knowledge of tools such as Jira, Jenkins, Team City, Azure, etc. is a plus. Excellent analytical, communicational, interpersonal & presentation skills. Ability to perform as an individual contributor who can handle client?? needs on his/her own Self-motivated, driven, result oriented, critical thinker and problem solver  Enjoy working in a fast-paced, global environment Should have bachelor?? degree in Engineering or equivalent Should be comfortable with short term national and international travel As an Automation Consultant, you will : Develop a deep understanding of the LEAPWORK Platform and its functionalities Develop workflows and custom solutions to address specific customer needs, Identify client needs, and showcase the best solutions  Perform test automation analysis, design leapwork framework for client?? product, create and execute tests on leapwork tool, monitor & report results of the assigned projects Engage with clients in both technical pre-and post-sales activities to ensure LEAPWORK adoption. Reviewing customer's automated test scripts, providing guidance to customers in implementing best practices, and fixing design/script issues Provide support to internal teams, customers, and partners??Implementation teams throughout their project implementation phase Document solutions and maintain best practices Learn and utilize new exciting technologies and how they integrate with LEAPWORK and help gather project requirements for integration with partner products Why Leapwork? We are on an exciting journey of global growth and this is your chance to get onboard. By joining our team, you??l become part of a fast-paced international environment where you can grow, challenge yourself, and do what inspires you. We work hard but have fun while doing it ??and we believe that collaboration, social activities and celebration are keys to success.

column2: Why Leapwork?   Leapwork is the leading visual test automation platform, revolutionizing the way businesses ensure quality in their softwarethrough an AI powered, visual and codeless approach.  In essence, Leapwork is a process automation platform enabling IT teams and other business users at over 500 global enterprises to adopt digital transformation securely, successfully, and with minimal implementation time.  Following welcoming major brands like PayPal, Mercedes-Benz, and Google to our customer portfolio, we were recently announced as a Strategic Partner of Microsoft.   If you're contemplating the next step in your career and seek a fast-paced company where you can impact the build and growth of something truly special, look no further!   We are looking for new talent to join our team and be part of our growth story as we rapidly expand across the globe.  What Leapwork offers:  Drive change: Be part of a transformative movement shaping the future of software.  Lead together: Our Nordic leadership style emphasizes transparency, mutual support, and leading by example. We believe in both guiding and being guided.  Growth potential: Leapwork offers substantial growth opportunities within the organization. If you're ready to learn and lead, your journey begins here.  Respectfully different: Our team thrives on respect and inclusivity. We embrace differences, nurturing a supportive culture that values each individual's uniqueness.  If you like the sound of this, wed love to hear from you!  Join Leapwork and be at the forefront of the test automation revolution.  Who are we looking for?   As an Associate Automation Architect, you will have a big impact on the growth of the company because of the significant role you play in ensuring the successful adoption of Leapwork by our customers.  Your primary objectives will be to work with our Enterprise customers and help them in automation strategy, Implementation, troubleshooting, best practices, adoption of Leapwork, and as a mentor for them using your deep technical knowledge and understanding of our product.  Since Leapwork is a fast-growing company in a high-growth market space, you will be expected to be very flexible and perform a wide variety of tasks.  Role Responsibilities:   Understand customer's requirements and purpose the best possible automation solutions to our customer's.  Perform test automation requirement analysis, test strategy design, automation estimation, and planning prioritization, execution, automation monitoring, and control.  Collaborate with different teams to assure architectural solutions could be suitably translated into effectual and robust implementation.  Reviewing customer's automated test scripts, providing guidance to customers in implementing best practices, and fixing design/script issues  Design and develop proofs-of-concept, demo to customers, and provide the architectural guidance to the end customers.  Assist pre-sales and sales in their client conversations in order to ensure maximum conversions and high-quality dialogue.  Provide test automation effort estimation to our sales team and create customer implementation plans based on customer prioritization.   Assist customer success team to ensure product value creation by technically involved with assigned customers throughout their customer life cycle.  Help customers in onboarding, adoption, and scaling, and getting success with the product.  Troubleshoot complex automation issues with customers and resolve them under agreed SLA.  Create a knowledge base, training materials, and provide community support to leads and customers.  Ensure that customer feedback is incorporated in Leapwork.  Engage with clients in both technical pre-and post-sales activities to ensure LEAPWORK adoption, here are the type of engagements.  Implementation  (Remote, when possible and On-Site, when not) - these are short/long term implementations you need to get involved time to time may be a few projects at a time remotely?  Tech Advisory Services - ??hort term implementation support??assistance calls in which we provide our view on necessary ??ow-To??questions  Health Checks - Should be formed as a checklist to be analysed and filled in, should cover the areas of test (definitions, docs), flow(Top Level design review), Infrastructure, Maintainability (a maintainability qualifier should be defined) and the result will be presented as a professional document detailing current status and recommendations. Most probably an on-site activity.  Flow Reviews - this is a detailed flow review as a service aiming to check Best Practices compliance and coverage.  Workshops - Roadmap presentations, Best Practices presentations, presentation in user groups, expo  Upgrade   Readiness - Analysis of an existing system to prepare a LEAPWORK upgrade  Technical Qualifications/ Role Requirements (Must - Have Skills)   Minimum 8+ years of proven, relevant Automation Experience.  Understanding of Enterprise Architecture and IT systems and value-based selling.  Working Knowledge on Automation Frameworks, test automation strategy, automation effort estimation, and test automation prioritization.  Excellent Leadership and convincing skills, ability to lead a small team from time to time.  Working Knowledge of automation tools such as Selenium Web Driver/VSTS/UFT/Any RPA tools etc.  Knowledge of at least one programming knowledge like C#/Java/Python.  Should possess good presentation and excellent communication skills.  Be experienced with agile, DevOps processes, source control, database, and CI/CD implementation.  Having knowledge of tools such as Jira, Jenkins, Team City, Azure, etc. is a plus.  Enjoy working in a fast-paced, global environment.  Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent preferred.  Comfortable with both national and international travel -Willingness to travel 50-70%

column2: Title:  Senior Automation Engineer & Test Lead Job Description: Position Overview:  We are seeking an experienced Senior Automation Engineer & Test Lead with a minimum of 8-12 years of hands-on experience in automation testing and leading testing teams. The ideal candidate should be proficient in C# coding, Selenium automation, API testing, and have extensive knowledge of Azure DevOps CI/CD pipelines. Responsibilities: Lead Automation Strategy:  Develop and implement the automation testing strategy, including defining frameworks, tools, and methodologies. Test Planning and Execution:  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to plan, design, and execute automated tests for web applications, APIs, and other software components. C# Coding:  Utilize C# programming skills to develop robust and maintainable automation scripts and frameworks. Selenium Automation:  Design and implement Selenium-based automation solutions for web application testing, ensuring scalability and reliability. API Testing:  Conduct thorough API testing using industry-standard tools and techniques, verifying functionality, performance, and security aspects. CI/CD Pipeline Integration:  Configure and maintain Azure DevOps CI/CD pipelines for automated build, test, and deployment processes. Team Leadership:  Lead and mentor a team of automation engineers, providing guidance, coaching, and technical expertise. Quality Assurance:  Ensure the quality of software products by identifying and addressing defects, maintaining test documentation, and advocating for best practices. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. 8-12 years of experience in software testing, with a focus on automation. Proficiency in C# programming language and experience in developing automation frameworks. Strong expertise in Selenium WebDriver for web application testing. Experience with API testing tools like Postman, SoapUI, or similar. Hands-on experience with Azure DevOps for CI/CD pipeline configuration and management. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Strong leadership abilities with experience in leading testing teams. Effective communication skills with the ability to collaborate across teams and stakeholders. Preferred Qualifications: Master's degree in Computer Science or related field. Relevant certifications in automation testing, such as ISTQB Advanced Level or Selenium WebDriver. Experience with performance testing tools like JMeter or LoadRunner. Knowledge of containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.

column2: Role Description This role is for QA Automation Tester responsible for design, development of automation framework, develop automated test cases & execute the same. The candidate is expected to ensure good quality, maintainable, scalable and high performing software applications are delivered to users in an Agile development environment. Candidate should be coming from a strong technological background. Should be hands on and be able to work independently requiring minimal technical/tool guidance. Should be able to technically guide and mentor junior resources in the team. As an automation tester you will bring rich expertise in Java to enforce the group of testers within a team. The candidate will extensively make use and apply Continuous Integration tools and practices in the context of Deutsche Banks digitalization journey. Your key responsibilities  Design and develop manual and automated test cases using current automation framework or develop your own solution for testing user stories and tasks, including end-2-end test with several components involved scripting and developing reusable automation code Create test data, writing and ownership test cases Perform peer code review Identify, track and own risks issues relating to test deliveries and program safety Actively participate into the sprint activities and ceremonies e.g. daily stand-up/scrum meeting, Sprint planning, retrospectives, etc Apply continuous integration best practices in general (SCM, build automation, unit testing, dependency management) Collaborate with other team members to achieve the Sprint objectives Report progress/update Agile team management tools (JIRA/Confluence) Manage individual task priorities and deliverables. Responsible for Software quality assurance throughout the delivery cycle including defect management Contribute to planning and continuous improvement activities, Support the PO, Analyst Scrum Master and Developers Work with BA/FA and Dev teams on building test cases Your skills, experience, and qualification:  Total experience of 4-8 Years, in functional/automation testing. Should have experience in JAVA, selenium & Rest Assured tool. Strong knowledge of automation framework like Karate, Postman, SOAP UI, BDD Cucumber. Very strong communication skills. Familiarity with all Agile practices, regulated environments and software development practices. Strong experience required in REST API, JSON, XML Experience in in other Agile approaches such as Kanban and XP would be desirable Background as an engineer/developer, tester or business analyst desirable

column2: Title: Senior Automation Testing Engineer Job Description: We are currently seeking a Senior Automation Testing Engineer with extensive experience in web automation using Selenium. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Java programming language, solid understanding of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) concepts, and familiarity with basic SQL and databases. Additionally, experience with Behavior Driven Development (BDD) using tools like Cucumber would be highly beneficial. Responsibilities: Develop and maintain automated test scripts for web applications using Selenium WebDriver. Utilize Java programming language and OOP concepts to create robust and maintainable test automation frameworks. Collaborate with developers, business analysts, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and define test scenarios. Execute automated test suites and analyze results to identify defects and areas for improvement. Work closely with the development team to troubleshoot issues and ensure timely resolution of defects. Participate in Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives. Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field. 4+ years of hands-on experience in web automation testing using Selenium WebDriver. Proficiency in Java programming language with a strong grasp of OOP concepts. Solid understanding of basic SQL and experience working with databases. Familiarity with BDD frameworks such as Cucumber. Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and continuous integration tools (e.g., Jenkins). Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
column11: Automation Selenium, OOPS, Java Programming, SQL Database, Bdd Cucumber

column1: Senior Software Development Engineer - Test - Automation Testing
column2: Role Overview : Paymerang is seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to join our dynamic and innovative QA team.  The Senior SDET will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products developed using React, Typescript, C#, Web APIs, AWS Lambda, and related technologies.  This individual will be responsible for designing and implementing comprehensive testing strategies, enhancing test automation frameworks, and collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to deliver exceptional software solutions. Key Responsibilities : Test Strategy and Planning :  - Collaborate with product managers, developers, and QA team members to understand project requirements and design comprehensive test strategies.  - Define testing scope, objectives, and deliverables aligned with the overall product goals.Test Automation :  - Design, develop, and maintain automated test suites and frameworks for front-end (React, Typescript) and back-end (C#, .NET Core, Web APIs, Lambda, NodeJS, etc.) components.  - Implement and expand UI and API test automation coverage to ensure thorough test coverage.Performance and Load Testing :  - Develop and execute performance and load testing scenarios to assess application scalability, responsiveness, and stability.  - Identify performance bottlenecks and work with the development team to optimize application performance.Continuous Integration and Deployment (CI/CD) :  - Integrate automated tests into the CI/CD pipeline to ensure consistent and timely feedback on the quality of each build.  - Monitor and report test results and provide insights to the development team for continuous improvement.Defect Analysis and Reporting :  - Collaborate with developers to reproduce, diagnose, and report defects.  - Provide detailed bug reports with clear steps to reproduce and necessary logs or screenshots. - Work with the team to prioritize and resolve issues efficiently.Test Environment Management :  - Set up and manage test environments, ensuring they accurately reflect the production environment.  - Collaborate with the operations team to maintain data integrity and environment consistency.Mentoring and Knowledge Sharing :  - Share expertise and best practices with fellow QA team members.  - Mentor junior SDET members and participate in training initiatives to enhance the team's technical skills. Qualifications : - Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.- Proven experience (5+ years) as an SDET or similar role, with a track record of designing and implementing automated testing solutions for complex software systems.- Strong proficiency in React, Typescript, C#, Web APIs, NodeJS, and AWS Lambda.- In-depth knowledge of test automation frameworks, tools, and methodologies.- Experience with performance testing tools (e.g., JMeter, Gatling) and load testing concepts.- Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and integration of automated tests.- Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues.- Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.- Relevant certifications (e.g., ISTQB, AWS) are a plus.
column11: Automation Testing, C#, AWS Lambda, ISTQB, Software Development, SDET, CI/CD, Quality Assurance, Web APIs, AWS, NodeJS

column2: Job Title-  Automation engineer (AVP) Location- Pune Role Description    Responsible for software quality assurance throughout the delivery cycle including defects management Identify, track and own risks / issues relating to test deliveries and program safety Work with BA/FA and Dev teams on building test cases Plan and implement full set of test automation activities: create, maintain and execute automated tests which cover functional, regression, load and stress testing. Develop and extend in-house testing automation tools and test frameworks Develop and coordinate end to end and industry/external facing integration; including scope, phases, automation and delivery priorities Define and implement Quality Service improvements in tangible, measurable way Work closely with agile delivery teams to extend best dev/test practices in SAFE environment Perform project/program reporting in accurate and timely manner Vendor/3-rd party vendor management for assurance of software/quality delivery Your key responsibilities  Analyze, Design, develop and enhancement of functional end to end test cases for real-time transaction surveillance solution around the HotScan product. Follow agile testing methodologies to ensure quality and consistency of deliveries.  As a testing delivery owner, you must drive and initiate communication with the other stakeholders and component owners from different areas. You should have clear understanding to develop and automate the testing of application (if applicable) for business & technical implementation/enhancements. You need to actively participate in the functional/technical discussion, asking right question, raising concern/risk and escalating it, explore and propose appropriate approaches, support the reusability of existing components. Manage and execute the automation suite and implement planned engineering changes according to agile principles / processes. Design, implementation, execution and results analysis of automated unit, integration, regression, resilience and performance tests. Problem and root cause analysis. Code reviews based on the four-eye approval and incorporate best coding practices. Implementation and compliance with bank policies (naming conventions, encryption, security settings and other non-functional requirements). Contribute to QA of delivery of package/changes as per requirements.  Presentation of QA approach and results in demo sessions Latest technology adoption for technical as well as business audience in demo sessions Expertise in understanding of client, business and technical requirements and problem-solving skills (analyzes the defects, identify the root-cause, and provide workaround/permanent solution). Exposure to Non-Functional Testing (Load, performance). Your skills and experience Bachelor of Science/Engineering degree from an accredited college or university with a concentration in Computer-Science or Software Engineering (or equivalent Total 6+ years of experience in IT industry with exposure to software Testing, development and maintenance of automation test suite, knowledge, and hand-on experience in implementing test automation frameworks. Hand-on experience in Test standards and procedures and testing non-functional requirements.  Experience of working in Agile teams Experience of working Matrix organization Must have skills- Technical Skills Overall 4+ Yrs of Functional Testing in Banking/payment/AML and experience in STLC , including at least one big project of 2 years duration in SDLC/STLC 2+ yrs of Automation Tool/Framework J2EE, Hands on with Selenium, Selenium Grid, Load Runner, JMeter. Experience with developing Automation Framework is a plus Functional Testing and Experience in Swift/MT/MX/ISO payments and protocols Experienced in testing interfaces Automation Testing with BDD Cucumber frameworks using Java, Selenium Web Driver Knowledge of SQL and proficient in writing DB queries in oracle. Programming: Java, Python Query/Scripting: Oracle SQL queries, shell script, python scripting Dev Framework: Sprint boot, REST API, Angular Unit Testing: Karma, Jasmin, JUnit, Mockito Middleware: IBM MQ, Active MQ Platforms/DevOps: OpenShift Cloud, Kubernetes Tools: Git, Maven, Artifactory, Jira, Confluence Domain/Functional Skills  Developing and Testing a Ticket/Case Management system with dashboards, workflows, and escalation process is a plus.   Payment Industry overview, MT/MX messaging  Agile & Testing Methodologies  DevOps working ways  Stakeholder Management & issue/problem triage   Requirements Management   Nice to have skills-  Domain : Embargo, Transaction Scanning/Sanction screening Knowledge of Microservices, REST, JSON, YAMLs, XML Quick development using modern IDEs like IntelliJ Idea, Visual Studio/Code Dev Ops: Jenkins, Team City, u-Deploy Advanced Oracle, Data Migration, Performance Tuning  Container: Docker, Kubernetes, any cloud platform

column2: Project Role : Test Automation Engineer Project Role Description : Transform testing into a continuous and efficient end-to-end quality engineering function through the use of quality processes, tools, and methodologies significantly improving control, accuracy and integrity. Evolve more predictive and intelligent testing approaches based on automation and innovative testing products and solutions. Must have skills : Micro Focus Unified Functional Testing (UFT) Good to have skills : Functional Test Planning Minimum  5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Any Graduate Summary :As a Test Automation Engineer, you will be responsible for transforming testing into a continuous and efficient end-to-end quality engineering function through the use of quality processes, tools, and methodologies. Your typical day will involve using Micro Focus Unified Functional Testing (UFT) to automate testing processes and improve control, accuracy, and integrity.  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead the development and implementation of automated testing processes using Micro Focus Unified Functional Testing (UFT) to improve control, accuracy, and integrity. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify testing requirements and develop test plans and strategies. Design and develop automated test scripts and frameworks using Micro Focus Unified Functional Testing (UFT) and other testing tools. Execute and maintain automated test suites, analyze test results, and report defects to stakeholders. Stay updated with the latest advancements in testing automation and innovative testing products and solutions. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Experience in Micro Focus Unified Functional Testing (UFT) and test automation. Good To Have Skills:Experience in functional test planning. Strong understanding of software testing methodologies and processes. Experience in developing and executing automated test scripts and frameworks. Experience in analyzing test results and reporting defects to stakeholders. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of experience in Micro Focus Unified Functional Testing (UFT) and test automation. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful testing solutions. This position is based at our Coimbatore office. Qualification Any Graduate Locations : Bengaluru,Chennai,Coimbatore,Hyderabad

column2: Lead engineer at Carrier Digital, you ll grow to lead high-performance software engineering teams that consistently deliver on commitments with continuous quality and efficiency improvements. Should know how to test, automate systems, processes, procedures to deliver a high-quality application.      Must work as Scam master for given project and conduct scam ceremonies and improve on agile metrics.      Must work with other members of a team and other departments to establish healthy communication and information flow.      Should know how to deliver a high-performing solution architecture that can support the development efforts of a business.      Plan, design, and test the most typical business solutions as needed. Prepare technical documents and other presentations for multiple solutions areas. Ensure that the best practices for configuration management are carried out as it was needed.      Must work on customer specifications, analyze them, and conduct the best product recommendations associated with the platform.      Must initiate a healthy discussion with the client and update them from time to time on the progress of a project.      Must understand the Company needs and architecture so that he can define the system specifications accordingly.      Responsible for planning, designing, and developing the solution architecture. Good to have Scam Master certified professional with an experience of running daily sprint and sprint deliverables.      Desirable to have experience in IoT domain and understanding on Embedded devices. Desirable to have experience in AWS services and using AWS services. Have strong verbal and written communications skills in English, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations and virtual teams.      Have executive speaking and presentation skills - including experience delivering formal presentations (to both large and small groups) and white-boarding sessions.          Education and Certifications         Bachelor s degree from a world-class school in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field preferred.      6+ years of experience working in a complex, matrixed organization.      6+ years of experience with front-end and user interface development. Certified in Agile (CSM, CSPO, SAFe)          Additional Skills         Detail oriented - you can see the big picture and break it down into small, digestible chunks      Passion for and understanding of technology - working knowledge of modern, cloud-based technology. Distributed computing expertise is a bonus.      Great communication - you can translate product requirements and designs into clear user stories, and communicate across product and technical teams to ensure requirements are understood and actionable.      Business acumen - a desire to understand how every new feature delights customers and impacts the business        Benefits:       We are committed to offering competitive benefits programs for all of our employees, and enhancing our programs when necessary.      Have peace of mind and body with our health insurance      Make yourself a priority with flexible schedules and leave Policy      Drive forward your career through professional development opportunities Achieve your personal goals with our Employee Assistance Program.

By connecting engineering and manufacturing operations every step of the way - from how products are designed and engineered, sourced and supplied, manufactured, to how they are serviced and renewed, we help them achieve greater productivity, drive growth and meet their sustainability commitments Know more:- www.youtube.com/watch?v=XaLxTEI3atI WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? Analysis of requirements from the specifications  Define and write automation steps against the specification  Develop code to implement the automation steps. Work with automation developers to realize the test automation for multiple features in parallel.  Identify and retire technical risks through evaluations and feasibility.  Identify and evaluate state of the art tools to continuously improve the test automation framework and process.  Own up the environment setup. Qualification Who are we looking for?  Preferably have aviation background and has willingness to learn.  Expertise in End-to -End Automation Testing.  Expert knowledge in UI, Performance Testing and API Testing.  Good to have knowledge in Test Automation tools like - Selenium, Selenium Web Driver, Cucumber, Jenkins pipeline and AWS Knowledge. column2: As part of the Product Security Technology and Solutions team, you will be on the forefront of all topics related to product security, customer expectations, Nokia internal security guidelines etc      You will be part of the Development team with as a Test Automation Engineer with a focus on the entire solution for areas of Test Automation and regression      This includes e2e feature analysis, interfacing with key users and architects      You will also be part of the team sharing the overall responsibility for the technical growth of the product and be responsible for quality improvements as needed                    Skills and Experience        6-8 years experience in e2e solution testing and automation with following skills:          Expertise in test automation, specifically for GUI automation with ROBOT Framework and Selenium.      Automation scripting expertise like Python, Perl, shell etc.      Strong scripting knowledge on the Linux OS.      Working experience of e2e testing on complex UI based products.      Knowledge of code versioning technologies such as Git.      Strong experience in designing and developing key word driven automation framework.      Experience in testing/automation of Security based products is a strong plus      Experience in security concepts like vulnerability analysis and Open source management is a plus      As an automation engineer, you ll have to work closely with other teams to help discover and eliminate problems by gathering requirements and implementing process automation. As an automation engineer, you will be expected to:        Gather feature requirements from Architects to develop the best automation solutions.        Design, Code and execute QA tests using scripts that automatically test e2e feature functionality.        Run tests for databases, systems, networks, applications, hardware and software.        Identify bugs and quality issues.        Actively maintain the Automated Regression suite on QA system for all solutions        Work with other teams to integrate the automated regression suite with build systems        Look for opportunities to automate all kind of manual repetitive tasks.

column2: Title: Senior Test Automation Engineer (Insurance Domain) Job Description: Position Overview:  We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Test Automation Engineer with a strong background in the insurance domain, particularly in actuarial calculations. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in functional testing, test automation, and Agile methodologies, with proficiency in tools such as Jira for Agile Scrum management. Additionally, expertise in database testing, specifically with ETL jobs, and automation experience with Java jobs and Core Java programming are essential for this role. Key Responsibilities: Functional Testing Expertise:  Utilize your in-depth understanding of functional testing principles to develop comprehensive test plans, execute test cases, and manage defects effectively, ensuring the quality and reliability of insurance software solutions. Test Automation:  Leverage your automation skills to design, develop, and maintain robust automated test suites using industry-standard frameworks, with a focus on improving test coverage and efficiency across the testing lifecycle. Agile Scrum Methodology:  Work collaboratively within Agile Scrum teams, utilizing tools such as Jira to plan sprints, track user stories, and facilitate seamless communication and coordination among team members to deliver high-quality software increments. Database Testing:  Apply your expertise in database testing techniques to validate the integrity, accuracy, and performance of ETL jobs, ensuring seamless data transformation and integration within insurance applications. Automation with Java:  Utilize your proficiency in Java programming to automate test scenarios, develop custom testing frameworks, and integrate automated tests into continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to achieve faster feedback loops. Actuarials Calculation:  Leverage your domain knowledge in insurance and actuarial calculations to understand business requirements, validate complex mathematical models, and ensure the accuracy and compliance of actuarial software solutions. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. 5+ years of experience in functional testing, test automation, Agile Scrum methodologies, test planning, execution, and defect management. 3+ years of experience in database testing, particularly with ETL jobs, and a strong understanding of data warehousing concepts. 2+ years of hands-on experience in automation with Java, including Core Java programming skills and proficiency in automation frameworks (e.g., Selenium, TestNG). Prior experience in the insurance domain, with a focus on actuarial calculations and insurance software solutions. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex business requirements and translate them into effective testing strategies. Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively within cross-functional Agile teams and interact with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
column11: Java, Actuarials, Agile, Functional Testing, ETL Testing, Scrum

column2: SDET role: Minimum experience into Automation is 3 years (includes script development and troubleshooting), which will help the candidate to have better understanding/exposure on Basic Programming Concepts (Access Modifiers/loops/conditions, methods, arrays, exception handling),OOPS concepts, Collection Frameworks (advanced like Array list, Hashmap, Hashset, Dictionary etc.,) Script synchronization techniques (like waits to ensure less scripts failures), Locators (basically id, name anyone can use but expectation is to create Xpaths using sibling concepts, dynamic texts based Xpaths, CSS selectors etc.,). Version Control System like Git is used by client and the candidate should have good understanding of the commands , if there is a situation where they need to work through cmd (instead of the features provided in Visual Studio or Eclipse) and Conflict management in case of code check-in. For API testing when manual is considered , the client uses Postman(validation of endpoint URLs) and Swagger( Documentation/ reference) tool where in the candidate should be aware of different Authorization Techniques, HTTP methods(CRUD) and Status codes based on the method/ in case of errors for both client/server. API Automation is again a different case where RestSharp along with BDD Specflow is used and it is good to have . Db testing is writing simple queries (with joins) based on project needs to join 3 or more tables and extract data to validate. Good communication skills(both written/oral) are mandatory for them to handle the calls/questions from client independently. SDET Lead: Along with the above details a SDET lead should have: Good understanding of Design Patterns like Singleton, SOLID Principles along with POM . Experience in Core Framework design and development from scratch (at least in one or two projects) . Should be able to handle code reviews for the team and mentor the team on technical aspects. Apart from the above, the criteria we look while screening the profile for initial round of interview: Candidate should have good experience to technical stack like Java/C# with BDD framework for both UI and API Automation. Tools/Technologies like Javascript,Playwright etc., is given lesser priority. Profiles with multiple company shifts in less time is not considered for initial level as we feel they will not be able to take ownership of the work. A big NO for candidates who take online help during interviews (for coding exercise given) who project more than 3 years but still unable to come up with a simple pseudocode are poor in logical thinking.

column2: IDESLABS PRIVATE LIMITED is looking for Automation Test Engineer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journeyAn Automation Test Engineer is responsible for designing and implementing automated tests to ensure that software systems are functioning correctly. The main responsibilities of this role include:     Test planning and design: The Automation Test Engineer must be able to plan and design automated tests that effectively cover all relevant aspects of the software. This involves creating test cases, test scripts, and other test artifacts.     Automated test development: The Automation Test Engineer must be able to develop automated tests using a variety of tools and technologies. This includes writing code, configuring test frameworks, and integrating automated tests into continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines.     Test execution and maintenance: The Automation Test Engineer must be able to execute automated tests, interpret test results, and maintain automated tests over time.        This involves fixing failed tests, updating tests to reflect changes in the software, and ensuring that automated tests continue to provide value.The ideal candidate for this role will have a strong technical background, with experience in software development and testing. They should have excellent problem-solving skills, the ability to work independently

column2: Whats your new role about?   As a QA Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of the products. If you are passionate about quality assurance, have a strong background in C# with Selenium, and possess a keen interest in the Finance/Loan domain, we invite you to contribute to our mission of delivering top-notch financial solutions.  Key Responsibilities:   Test Automation:   Develop and maintain automated test scripts using C# and Selenium for web applications.  Execute automated tests and analyze results to identify and report defects.  Behavior-Driven Development (BDD):   If applicable, utilize SpecFlow for behavior-driven development to enhance test scenarios and collaboration with stakeholders.  Contribute to creating and maintaining Gherkin-style feature files.  Manual Testing:   Conduct manual testing as needed, including exploratory testing and regression testing.  Document test cases, test scenarios, and test results.  Collaboration and Communication:   Collaborate with development teams to understand project requirements and identify test scenarios.  Communicate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.  Domain Knowledge:   If applicable, develop an understanding of the Finance/Loan domain to align testing activities with business requirements.  Must have:   Proficient in C# for test automation.  Experience with Selenium for web application testing.  Must Have Core Traits:??? Softskills   Demonstrated ownership of decisions, actions, challenges, and solutions  Thorough problem-solving skills to implementing cost-effective solutions  Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills, fosters open communications, listens effectively, and builds strong partnership networks that result in consistent forward momentum  Skilled at solving challenges in a directed, methodical manner and analyzes the current issue to envision creative solutions  Takes initiative to complete critical tasks, especially in team settings with dependencies on other people  Works effectively in the face of stress, ambiguity, difficult situations, and shifting priorities  Steps outside of ??omfort zone??to tackle new issues/challenges in an aggressive manner; deals well with ambiguity in a fast-paced, cutting-edge, and entrepreneurial environment  Challenges the status quo to generate new ideas and implements unique solutions to fix challenging problems  Collaborates and openly seeks and shares information across teams and departments  Has a solid background in his or her technical field and continually augments experience and skills with the latest research results and techniques  Demonstrates a bold commitment to the total alignment of actions, words, and professional beliefs Nice to have:   Familiarity with SpecFlow for behavior-driven development (BDD).  Interest in or exposure to the Finance/Loan domain.

column2: Project Role : Test Automation Engineer Project Role Description : Transform testing into a continuous and efficient end-to-end quality engineering function through the use of quality processes, tools, and methodologies significantly improving control, accuracy and integrity. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering high-quality software products. This position is based at our Pune office.-Candidate to work in a shift till 10 PM

Your typical day will involve developing and implementing automated testing solutions, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and continuously improving testing processes.  Roles & Responsibilities: 5-7 years of strong experience in both Manual and Automation testing-Should analyze Business Requirement documents to get better understanding of the system both on technical and business perspectives.-Should contribute to Agile ceremonies, and actively participate in discussions related to Test strategy, Test planning, and defect resolution.-Should Design and implement Selenium WebDriver Automation test framework for Smoke and Regression test suites-Should create/design test scripts that covers various functionalities of the application and ensure optimal test coverage is achieved-Should automate test cases to support frequent requirement changes-Should integrate automated tests with Continuous integration (CI) tools like Jenkins/GitLab/similar, and contribute to the overall DevOps process.-Should ready to work in Manual test case creation and execution work-Should apply effective Communication and Collaboration skills while working with various stakeholders including Technical Lead, Developers, Product owners, Scrum Master etc. -Should proactively monitor the test execution process, report any issues or anomalies, and work with stakeholders to address them effectively.-Should be able to identify potential risks, analyze their impact on the testing efforts, and develop mitigation strategies Professional & Technical Skills: Proficiency in Programming Languages :Core Java, Java Script/VB Script-Expertise on Automation Test Tools:Selenium-Web driver/similar, TestNG/similar-Experience in Designing Automation Test Framework-Experience in Manual Testing:Manual Testing processes, Test techniques, Software Testing life Cycle (STLC), Design and execute test cases, Test coverage and identify potential defects -Expertise in Test Script Development:Create efficient and reusable test scripts, automate regression test suit, cover various functionalities of the application, optimal test coverage -Clear understanding of Business Requirements:thorough understanding of Business requirements, design accurate test cases, identify potential risks, meets desired quality standards -Strong in Analytical, Communication, Collaboration and Problem Solving skills -Experience of working in Agile-Scrum-Familiarity with DevOps, and Continuous Delivery Good-to-have skill  Basics of AWS Cloud Computing -Testing Certification:ISTQB Foundation/Advance Level or ISTQB Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of experience in Automated Testing. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in Computer Science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions. This position is based at our Pune office. Qualification 15 years minimum fulltime education

column2: An automation specialist at Innomation is at the heart of any project and is involved from conceptualization to commissioning of the automation solution. Due to the variety of tasks involved and skills required, the candidate shall be undergoing on the job training for up to 2 years. Post this training period, the automation specialist shall be deputed to a project and shall be responsible for the following.       Site study, data gathering and application study post enquiry receipt.     Conceptualization of a solution, prototyping and validation of the concept along with R&D team.     Costing and building a techno-commercial proposal along with marketing team.     Discussions, negotiations and finalization of the order along with marketing team.     Design, detail engineering for manufacturability of parts and development of the automation solution from concept to 2D drawings and validation of the design w.r.t the project?? technical and commercial deliverables. Ability to use mechanical engineering subjects for design analysis is a must.     Planning and coordination with the manufacturing and procurement team for timey delivery of all components within budget.     Coordination between the manufacturing team and the quality control team for decisions regarding accept, re-work, reject for all components.     Planning and supervising the assembly team for machine assembly.     Planning and supervising the wiring team for machine wiring and integration.     Planning and supervising the PLC programming team in developing the machine software.     Testing and troubleshooting the machine and ensuring that the machine performance is at par or above the deliverables and if required modifying the machine design to ensure the same.     Demonstration of the machine performance at Innomation factory to client and ensuring client satisfaction.     Planning and supervising the packing and forwarding team in transportation of the machine from the Innomation?? factory to the client?? factory.     Planning & supervising the installation & commissioning team in demonstrating the machine performance to the client at site to the client?? satisfaction and subsequently handing over the machine to the client.     Coordination between the client and our service team to ensure the client can utilize the machine as per the performance deliverables guaranteed.         Skills Required   :       Advanced knowledge in AutoCAD, Autodesk Inventor, MS Office is required for the job and shall be part of the training. However, prior knowledge is a bonus.     Fundamentals of mechanical engineering, especially core subjects such as design of machine elements, mechanisms, manufacturing methods and metallurgy are essential.     Ability to follow directions, manage multiple tasks, meet deadlines, and respond to urgent requests in a positive manner.     Good organizational skills, accuracy, and attention to detail.     Must be able to communicate professionally during stressful situations, resolving problems effectively and positively.     Team player with a positive attitude, strong verbal and written communication skills and excellent interpersonal skills.     Able to sustain extensive periods of travel and working in harsh industrial environments.

column2: Having quick turnaround and increased test coverage is the need of the hour; hence the increased emphasis on automation testing across projects.     Publicis Sapient is looking for automation experts who in addition to the expertise in the tools and techniques also have the knack to understand the business needs, ROI and accordingly create the automation strategy.     Assures consistent quality of Software Applications production by developing and enforcing robust Automated Software QE strategy, practices, and processes, providing documentation and managing people.     They collaborate the with the project, business and (QE) teams, to develop detailed automated scripts, test frameworks to make the overall system more effective and efficient for our clients.     Responsible for the overall quality of the project through effective QE leadership and management to ensure that all deliverables in terms of time, price and quality are met.     This individual must have a proven track record of success building, leading, and managing a functional and technical QE team with a strong sense of quality ownership.     This is a hands-on job that requires strategic thinking and planning to provide leadership and expertise throughout the entire QA lifecycle, ensuring the success of the team's manual and automation efforts in an agile working environment     Able to estimate for low and medium complexity applications and have used at least one of the estimation techniques.     Able to handle/oversight a small team ranging from 2 -5 people and can guide them during the complete SDLC cycle starting from test case creation till test closure activities     Well-versed with the most of the activities in defect management process, can define/enhance the defect documentation and TAR lifecycle process independently     Have expertise to enforce/adhere defect or other processes in the team Preferred (Mostly for people being hired at the Senior Associate Career Stage)     Mentored or coached at least one person     Can define Automation Test strategy and test plan for low and medium complexity applications taking into account the business needs, ROI etc.     Able to maintain and report test coverage matrix Able to identify device coverage for the application in question.     Can devise regression testing approach           6-9 years of experience.     Experience with QE for distributed, highly scalable systems     Good understanding of OOPS concepts and strong programming skills in Java, Groovy, or JavaScript     Hands-on experience in working with at least one GUI-based test automation tool for desktop and/or mobile automation. Experience with multiple tools will be added advantage     Proficient in writing SQL queries     Familiarity with the process of test automation tool selection & test approach     Experience in designing and developing automation frameworks and creation of scripts using best industry practices such as Page object model     Integrate test suites into the test management system and custom test harness     Familiar with the implementation of design patterns, modularization, and user libraries for framework creation     Can mentor team as well as has short learning curve for new technology     Understands all aspects of Quality Engineering     Understanding of SOAP and REST principles     Thorough understanding of microservices architecture     In-depth hands-on experience of working with at least one API testing tool like RestAssured, SOAP UI, NodeJS     Hands-on experience working with Postman or similar tool     Hands-on experience in parsing complex JSON & XML and data validation using serialization techniques like POJO classes or similar     Hands-on experience in performing Request and Response Schema validation, Response codes, and exceptions     Good Understanding of BDD, TDD methodologies, and tools like Cucumber, TestNG, Junit, or similar.     Experience in defining API E2E testing strategy, designing and developing API automation framework     Working experience on building tools Maven / Gradle, Git, etc.     Experience in creating test pipeline - CI/CD     Possess domain knowledge to identify issues across those domains, understand their impact, and drive resolution [(familiar/expert in domains like retail banking, automobile, insurance, betting, food markets, hotel industry, healthcare)     Used /Exposure to automation tool for automating mobile applications     Used /Exposure to automation tool for non-functional testing     To set up test environment for execution on cloud environments such as Sauce Labs, browser stack     Knowledge of new tools (open source & licensed) in the automation world and have the knack to explore them and keep abreast with the latest tools in the market     Expertise in creating test automation frameworks, implementing and maintaining them on a project Experience in the modern agile practices such as BDD/Cucumber, DevOps     Knowledge and experience in service virtualization and tools like CA Lisa     Hands-on knowledge of setting up PACT Broker and writing PACT tests is desirable     Experience in test management tools like Xray & Zephyr and integration of test framework with these tools     Understanding of commonly used software design patterns like Builder, Factory, Singleton and Fa ade     Possess excellent Communication skills (written, verbal both formal & informal)     Helps to create a positive, collaborative working environment for the team.     Quick grasping and flexibility to adapt to new technologies/processes     Ability to multi-task under pressure and work independently with minimal supervision. i.e. Ability to prioritize when under pressure     Efficiently makes tough decisions and communicates them effectively.     Independently manages operational level client meetings. Develops strong relationships with appropriate client stakeholders. Acts as the primary POC/facilitator for planned (regular) client meetings. Manages peer-level client relationships (expectations, communications, negotiations, escalation, feedback, etc.)       Education: Full time Bachelor s/Master s engineering degree

column2: As a Test Specialist at IBM, your analytical and technical skills will directly impact the quality of the software we create. Come work in an agile environment where you will help each iteration reach the next level. Whether the testing is manual, automated, or cognitive, you hold a key role in releasing the best deliverables to IBMers and our clients. Your Role and Responsibilities As an Automation Testing Practitioner, you will design, build, test and deploy effective testing solutions which reduce the amount of manual effort in the testing process. You are responsible for applying automated tools in testing of applications across all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Support the test team by recommending tools and processes  To automate other test activities, such as test management, reporting, test data generation and defect management. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Minimum 4+ years of experience in Quality Assurance and Software Testing Profound knowledge of Software Development Processes and Testing life cycle. Working knowledge of Java 1.7 with Selenium/Appium, Cucumber, and BDD Tools along with an understanding of TestNG/Junit, Ant/Maven and Jenkins Hands-on experience in the development of application changes, testing the changes, and driving continuous delivery transformation within Scrum teams. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Knowledge of the commercial product ARIC from the Feature space will be an advantage Experience in MongoDB and WebServices testing is highly desired Ambitious individual who can work under their own direction towards agreed targets/goals.
column11: ant, java, selenium, jenkins, testng, junit, software development, bdd, appium, cucumber, automation testing, web services testing, quality engineering, testing life cycle, mongodb

column2: Fair compensation: We believe in providing competitive salaries that reflect the value and expertise of our team members.          Paid Leave: We understand the importance of work-life balance and offer generous paid leave to support our employees well-being and personal commitments.          Work-life balance: We prioritize creating a healthy work-life balance for our employees, recognizing the importance of maintaining personal and professional harmony.          Flexible Working: We offer flexible working arrangements to accommodate individual preferences and needs, enabling our employees to optimize their productivity and achieve a better work-life integration.          Activities & events: We organize various activities and events to foster team bonding, creativity, and a positive work culture. These events provide opportunities for relaxation, celebration, and building connections within the DIAGNAL community.          Learning & Development program: We are committed to the growth and development of our employees. Our learning and development programs offer continuous opportunities to enhance skills, acquire new knowledge, and stay updated with the latest industry trends.          Growth: We provide a platform for professional growth, enabling employees to take on new challenges, expand their skill sets, and advance their careers within DIAGNAL.          Talented People: We are proud to have a team of talented individuals who are passionate about their work and contribute to our collective success. Working alongside skilled professionals, you ll have the opportunity to learn, collaborate, and be inspired.          Collaboration: We foster a collaborative work environment where teamwork and open communication are valued. You ll have the chance to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including designers, project managers, QA engineers, operations engineers, third-party systems providers, and customers, to deliver exceptional products.          Impactful Products: Joining DIAGNAL means being part of a team that creates impactful products used by millions of users. Your work will have a direct influence on the digital entertainment industry and contribute to our mission of delivering high-quality experiences.          Freedom: We trust our employees and believe in providing them with the freedom to make decisions and execute their work without excessive micromanagement. We value autonomy and encourage independent thinking.          Feel valued: We genuinely value the contributions and efforts of our team members. We strive to create an inclusive and supportive environment where everyone feels valued, recognized, and appreciated.                Role            The position we are looking to fill will be a 1 year fixed term contract          This role will include testing applications in the Arabic language interface, therefore proficiency (reading/writing/speaking) in the Arabic language is required          This role will focus on ensuring the quality of digital entertainment products that are used by millions of users          Work fast. The industry moves fast to meet launch timelines with big advertising and content production budgets at stake. We make quick releases to receive customer and user feedback which helps us create the very best products on the market          Partner with designers, project managers, operations engineers, third party systems providers and customers          At all times consider how to deliver the highest quality product instead of taking shortcuts to get the job done.          Strive for continuous product quality improvement with feedback to designers, product managers and systems architects          Test backend systems and systems integrations that support business operations          Test for functionality, UIUX fidelity, high availability, stability and performance          Be responsible for implementing QA automation across the organization and will be expected to come in and hit the ground running.          Defining test plans, test cases, and test data to be used for both automated and manual testing.          Contribute and Maintain our Continuous Integration/Delivery pipeline          Think about and implement automation to make your team s tasks as efficient as possible          Strive for continuous product quality improvement with feedback to designers, product managers and systems architects                Experience Required            5+ years of total experience          An excellent command of the Arabic and English language          An engineering Degree in computer science or equivalent practical experience or 5 or more years of experience of manual and automated testing in a premium software project services or software product company working with international customers / stakeholders          Experience with standard testing tools/frameworks e.g. Mercury, JUnit, JMeter, Selenium, Appium, Eggplant, Sahi, Calabash          Experience in working on an automated testing pipeline that includes unit, functional and system level tests driven by an integrated framework.          Understanding of HTTP and application on RESTful API testing          Ability to write scripts/programs to test applications

column2: Position Overview: We are currently seeking an experienced Automation Test Engineer with a strong proficiency in Python to join our QA team. Expertise in developing robust test automation frameworks and scripts using Python. Strong debugging and troubleshooting skills to identify and resolve issues efficiently. Experience in automating desktop-based applications is essential. Familiarity with TestComplete or similar tools for desktop application automation is a plus. Excellent communication and collaboration skills with a proactive approach to problem-solving. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

column2: SDET role: Minimum experience into Automation is 3 years (includes script development and troubleshooting), which will help the candidate to have better understanding/exposure on Basic Programming Concepts (Access Modifiers/loops/conditions, methods, arrays, exception handling),OOPS concepts, Collection Frameworks (advanced like Array list, Hashmap, Hashset, Dictionary etc.,) Script synchronization techniques (like waits to ensure less scripts failures), Locators (basically id, name anyone can use but expectation is to create Xpaths using sibling concepts, dynamic texts based Xpaths, CSS selectors etc.,). Version Control System like Git is used by client and the candidate should have good understanding of the commands , if there is a situation where they need to work through cmd (instead of the features provided in Visual Studio or Eclipse) and Conflict management in case of code check-in. For API testing when manual is considered , the client uses Postman(validation of endpoint URLs) and Swagger( Documentation/ reference) tool where in the candidate should be aware of different Authorization Techniques, HTTP methods(CRUD) and Status codes based on the method/ in case of errors for both client/server. API Automation is again a different case where RestSharp along with BDD Specflow is used and it is good to have . Db testing is writing simple queries (with joins) based on project needs to join 3 or more tables and extract data to validate. Good communication skills(both written/oral) are mandatory for them to handle the calls/questions from client independently. SDET Lead: Along with the above details a SDET lead should have: Good understanding of Design Patterns like Singleton, SOLID Principles along with POM . Experience in Core Framework design and development from scratch (at least in one or two projects) . Should be able to handle code reviews for the team and mentor the team on technical aspects. Apart from the above, the criteria we look while screening the profile for initial round of interview: Candidate should have good experience to technical stack like Java/C# with BDD framework for both UI and API Automation. Tools/Technologies like Javascript,Playwright etc., is given lesser priority. Profiles with multiple company shifts in less time is not considered for initial level as we feel they will not be able to take ownership of the work. A big NO for candidates who take online help during interviews (for coding exercise given) who project more than 3 years but still unable to come up with a simple pseudocode are poor in logical thinking.
column11: C#, SDET, Automation Framework, API Testing, SQL

column2: We require a highly competent, technically minded individual who can complete a wide range of tasks ranging from IT system testing, business analysis, data analysis and report writing. Your initial role will be primarily focused on testing for at least a year where you will be undertaking both manual tests on systems and databases and automated tests (both executing them and creating additional ones).  Once you are familiar with our systems and processes, we want you to contribute in various other areas of our business. Your flexibility and broad range of skills will make you a valuable member of our team. You must be willing and prepared to perform whatever task may be required. We want someone strong, confident, and able to speak to clients and lead parts of engagements as a core member of our team. column2: Job Description: We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Automation Test Engineer with more than 5 years of hands-on experience to join our team. The ideal candidate will have expertise in automation testing using Selenium and Java, proficiency in Cucumber for behavior-driven development (BDD), and a strong background in creating and maintaining test automation frameworks. Additionally, candidates should be proficient in Jenkins for continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD), GitHub for version control, and cloud testing platforms such as Sauce Labs. Key Responsibilities: Develop and maintain robust automation test scripts using Selenium and Java to ensure the quality and reliability of our software products. Implement behavior-driven development (BDD) approach using Cucumber to facilitate collaboration between technical and non-technical stakeholders. Create and maintain automation test frameworks to streamline the testing process and improve test coverage. Set up and configure Jenkins pipelines for continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) and manage code repositories in GitHub. Conduct cloud testing using platforms like Sauce Labs to validate application functionality across different environments and browsers. Automate existing test cases and script new features to support agile development and release cycles. Prepare comprehensive test cases, execute tests, and analyze test results to identify defects and ensure product quality. Perform maintenance and failure analysis of test cases, troubleshoot issues, and ensure timely resolution. Utilize defect management tools to track, prioritize, and report defects throughout the testing lifecycle. Integrate code changes into GitHub and ensure version control and collaboration among team members. Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders, providing updates on test progress, issues, and resolutions. Qualifications: 5+ years of experience in automation testing, with a focus on Selenium and Java. Proficiency in Cucumber for behavior-driven development (BDD) testing. Experience in creating and maintaining automation test frameworks. Strong knowledge of Jenkins for continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD), GitHub for version control, and cloud testing platforms such as Sauce Labs. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced agile environment. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
