column2: You will be responsible for a wide range of QA areas including creation of test plans, scripts, performance plans, and automation of those into DevOps pipelines for continuous testing of high level control software platforms and applications. As a member of an agile team working with Sr. Developers, Architects, and Integration Engineers, you participate in various product development and project specific projects. You can work independently and take responsibility for testing coverage of the SDLC from test plan, reporting, and release validation. You will also coach and train others on testing best practices and standards, continuously evaluating new techniques and technologies to improve the organizations quality through a customer-centric approach.           Essential Functions (Job Duties and Responsibilities)           Solid understanding of duties performed within entire software development life cycle, tools, and language(s) to include:       Collaborate with Product Owners/BA s/Architects in refinement and defining story acceptance criteria for controls-based software utilized in automated systems for material movement     Analyze system requirements and review technical specifications to assess, evaluate, and create testing requirements for all software components for functional and end-to-end scenarios     Follows and coaches best practices for construction and utilization of Hybrid Testing Framework (data-driven, Keyword Driven) to support both Dev and DevOps in Test/Behavior driven designs and DevOps CI/CD pipelines for test automation/integration.     Collaborate and contribute to automation test system architecture, methodologies, and processes using industry best practices and innovation of testing framework     Design, construct, and maintain automated test reporting infrastructure for providing technical, project, and business visibility to software quality at various stages of the CI/CD and SDLC     Assist with performance test creation, execution, and integration into CI/CD     Collaborate with deployment engineers around customer acceptance test plans evaluating areas of automation prior to software deployment     Works as a multi-skilled professional practicing SAFe Agile in both a SCRUM/Kanban methodology     Taking part in continuous improvement through sharing of knowledge and coaching within the team                 Required Education and Experience          Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or equivalent     A Minimum of 8 years working experience as a QA Engineer and at least 2 of those years in working with complex testing frameworks supporting automation and CI/CD pipelines     Core JAVA 8 and above / Spring Boot experience     At least 2 years developing automated test, using 1 or more of these languages: Java or JavaScript.     Knowledgeable on testing tools with experience in the following:     API Testing - Postman, SoapUI (required work experience in at least one option)     UI Automation Testing: Selenium, Cypress (required work experience in at least one option)     BDD Framework: Cucumber (Java, JavaScript)     Performance Testing: JMeter         Demonstrated ability to perform complex test analysis, test case construction/automation and defect documentation for reproduction.     Demonstrated and effective time management, organizational, prioritization, and planning skills along with the ability to work within a single team and across multiple teams and projects.     Experience in working with GIT (Bitbucket), SVN or other distributed source control systems     Working knowledge of developing/deployment of test systems/frameworks within cloud systems (Azure, AWS, etc.)     Knowledge about Kafka or similar MQ system                 Preferred Qualifications         Controls software testing within various industrial environments like baggage handling, Warehouse Control/Execution software or equivalent     Working experience with Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo etc.)     Experience testing cloud-based software with domain driven designs using Docker and Kubernetes     Experience with SQL language in one or more database platforms (Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MS SQL)     Integration of testing controls into CI/CD pipeline and within release management processes     Certification with TMAP and/or ISTQB is a plus, but not required     Also a plus:     Performance Testing: LoadRunner     UI Automation Testing: Katalon Studio     BDD Framework: Spec Flow (.Net C#)                 Knowledge-Skills-Abilities (Competencies)          Effective communication skills (written and verbal).     Good interpersonal skills (work well within a team).     Be able to contribute to the onboarding process of new team members.     Ability to work in a fast-paced operational environment with competing priorities and multiple stakeholders.     Strong analytical abilities and able to make recommendations in written and verbal form.     Able to work unsupervised, take initiative and resolve issues.

column2: Role & Responsibilities : - 7 years of experience in Design and determine test plans, scenarios, scripts, procedures, coding and integration activities based on general objectives and knowledge of overall architecture of product. - Write scripts to automate testing and create tools so developers can test their own code. - As a Test Engineer, you should be comfortable (and love) to navigate massive codebases, identify (read as discover) weak spots and constantly design better and creative ways to crash the software and identify potential problems. - To be instrumental in designing the strategy, pioneering ways and means to test software and ensure no bug leaves the premise alive. - Lead/collaborate on improving developer and engineering team's test coverage, release velocity and production health. - Work closely with development teams in instrumenting their workflow to build a comprehensive picture of velocity, coverage and quality. - Hands-on ability to automate repeated tasks and build test coverage through existing or new infrastructure. - Write moderately complex code/scripts to test systems, implementing test harnesses and infrastructure as necessary. Skill Requisite : - A minimum of 5 years of testing experience. - Strong technical skill set with knowledge of manual and automation testing - Automation Skill set - Java - Selenium - Restassured - Junit and/or Nunit - Watir - TestNG (Java) - Excel and Word (for recording purpose) - One or more of desktop Automation Tools (Ranorex, WinAppDriver, AutoIt, Winium, Sikuli, PywinAuto, Win.Forn, Robot Class, Inspect, Snoop) - Experience with Postman and/or Rest.Assured. - Should have experience with Preparing/Analyzing Test plan and test cases with strong experience in Test Metrics and reporting.

column2: We are seeking a skilled and passionate Senior QA Automation Engineer (Cypress) to join our quality assurance team. In this position, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the reliability and functionality of our web applications by designing, developing, and maintaining automated tests using Cypress. You will work closely with our development and QA teams to drive test automation best practices and help deliver high-quality software.  Responsibilities:  - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and define test    automation strategies.  - Develop and maintain end-to-end test suites using Cypress to validate web applications.  - Create and execute automated test scripts for regression, functional, and performance testing.  - Identify and report defects, track issues, and work with developers to ensure timely resolution.  - Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for automated    testing.  - Write clear and concise test documentation, including test plans and test cases.  - Participate in code reviews to maintain code quality and ensure best practices.  - Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in test automation and share knowledge    within the team.  Qualifications:  - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.  - 4+ years of non internship Industry experience in test automation using Cypress. - Experience with SQL queries and database objects  - Strong proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript.  - Experience with modern web development technologies (HTML5, CSS3, React, Angular, etc.).  - Familiarity with API testing and tools like Postman or similar.  - Knowledge of software testing methodologies, best practices, and test design techniques.  - Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).  - Strong problem-solving and debugging skills. - Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.  - Experience with CI/CD tools like Jenkins, Travis CI, or similar is a plus.  - Experience with performance testing and load testing tools is a plus. - Need working experience in an Agile/Scrum development process. Highly desired qualifications:  - Test Management Tools: Jira, Zephyr, HP Quality Center, etc.  - Test Automation Tools: Selenium, Cypress, TestComplete, Robot framework, etc.  - Experience with Python, Java, Java scripts, core java  - Performance Testing Tools: LoadRunner, Jmeter, Gatling, etc.  - Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) Tools: Jenkins, GitHub actions, etc.  - Code Repository Tools: Git, SVN, etc. ??Virtualization Tools: VirtualBox, VMware, Docker, etc. Perks and benefits: Health insurance. column2: The Test Automation Engineer will play a critical role in ensuring the quality of our software applications by designing, developing, and maintaining automated testing frameworks and test suites. As a key member of our team, we expect the Test Automation Engineer to bring expertise in automated testing tools, programming languages, and software development methodologies to the table. The intention is to work closely with developers, quality assurance analysts, and project managers to ensure that our testing process is efficient, effective, and seamlessly integrated with our software development lifecycle. Responsibilities: Drive a flexible process flow to accomplish customer-focused delivery and signoffs while leading a small to medium-sized team from the front. Design and develop automated testing frameworks and test suites. Create and maintain test automation scripts using programming languages such as Java, C#, Python, or JavaScript. Design and implement testing procedures in collaboration with developers to guarantee the high quality of software releases. Conduct exploratory testing to identify potential issues and improve test coverage. Perform regression testing to ensure application consistency. Analyse results and report bugs to developers using bug-tracking tools such as JIRA or ALM. Continuously improve automated testing practices and procedures to improve overall testing efficiency and effectiveness. Keep abreast of the most recent automated testing tools and techniques and offer suggestions for ways to streamline the testing procedure. Encourage industry practices for Non-functional testing, such as Performance Testing, Security Testing, Accessibility Testing etc. to leverage customer relationships. Work as Quality Engineer to ensure that testing aligns with business requirements. Develop and maintain documentation related to testing procedures and frameworks. Collaborate in code reviews and provide feedback on the testability of code. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field. 2-4 years of experience in test automation in the software development industry. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Strong programming skills in Java or C#. Experience in Python or JavaScript is an extra edge. Hands-on automated experience using Selenium, Appium, WebDriverIO, Cypress etc. Working experience with Salesforce applications is an advantage. Nice to have API testing knowledge and hands-on in Postman. Familiarity with software development methodologies such as Agile or Scrum. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced environment. We offer a competitive PayScale, a comprehensive benefits package, and the opportunity to work with a dynamic team of professionals in a challenging and rewarding environment. We welcome a self-starter who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment and has a passion for software testing.

column2: SDET role: Minimum experience into Automation is 3 years (includes script development and troubleshooting), which will help the candidate to have better understanding/exposure on Basic Programming Concepts (Access Modifiers/loops/conditions, methods, arrays, exception handling),OOPS concepts, Collection Frameworks (advanced like Array list, Hashmap, Hashset, Dictionary etc.,) Script synchronization techniques (like waits to ensure less scripts failures), Locators (basically id, name anyone can use but expectation is to create Xpaths using sibling concepts, dynamic texts based Xpaths, CSS selectors etc.,). Version Control System like Git is used by client and the candidate should have good understanding of the commands , if there is a situation where they need to work through cmd (instead of the features provided in Visual Studio or Eclipse) and Conflict management in case of code check-in. For API testing when manual is considered , the client uses Postman(validation of endpoint URLs) and Swagger( Documentation/ reference) tool where in the candidate should be aware of different Authorization Techniques, HTTP methods(CRUD) and Status codes based on the method/ in case of errors for both client/server. API Automation is again a different case where RestSharp along with BDD Specflow is used and it is good to have . Db testing is writing simple queries (with joins) based on project needs to join 3 or more tables and extract data to validate. Good communication skills(both written/oral) are mandatory for them to handle the calls/questions from client independently. SDET Lead: Along with the above details a SDET lead should have: Good understanding of Design Patterns like Singleton, SOLID Principles along with POM . Experience in Core Framework design and development from scratch (at least in one or two projects) . Should be able to handle code reviews for the team and mentor the team on technical aspects. Apart from the above, the criteria we look while screening the profile for initial round of interview: Candidate should have good experience to technical stack like Java/C# with BDD framework for both UI and API Automation. Tools/Technologies like Javascript,Playwright etc., is given lesser priority. Profiles with multiple company shifts in less time is not considered for initial level as we feel they will not be able to take ownership of the work. A big NO for candidates who take online help during interviews (for coding exercise given) who project more than 3 years but still unable to come up with a simple pseudocode are poor in logical thinking.

column2: Over the next three years, our goal is to transform the 268 billion analogue phone calls between a brand and it s consumers to digital on the LiveEngage platform     By doing this, we enable consumers to get back time and experience a more connected relationship with the brand in which sales, service, marketing, branches, stores, and contact centers become a unified experience     The successful candidate has an opportunity to join a highly outstanding team within a fast-paced and successful organization       You Will           We are looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) engineer to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality.      QA engineer responsibilities include understanding system requirements, designing and implementing tests and in some cases debugging and defining corrective actions.      You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect densities and open defect counts.)     Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback     Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases     Create System, Resiliency and Performance verification test plans and test cases     Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities     Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools     Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs     Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved     Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needs     Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements     Monitor debugging process results     Investigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to implement solutions     Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts     Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies         You Have           5+ Years of experience     BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject     Proven work experience in software quality assurance     Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes     Experience testing SPA and REST based API s in microservices based software     Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases     Strong programming skills in one of the languages such as: Java, Python, Go, Groovy, Proven, Javascript     Experience is QA automation tools, frameworks and libraries     Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing     Hands-on experience with automated testing tools and libraries     Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process     Experience with performance, resiliency and/or security testing is a must     Experience testing high scalable distributed systems is a must     Experience working with Chaos Monkey, JMeter is a plus     Knowledge of CI/CD and experience working with Jenkins or similar tools

column2: Project Role : Application Automation Engineer Project Role Description : Apply innovative ideas to drive the automation of Delivery Analytics at the client level.  Must have skills : Selenium Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : BE Summary :At EE, we are building new commerce's digital platforms to enable our business to bring exciting products to our amazing customers. Quality is at the heart of what we do, we are hiring a number of QA automation Engineering roles, of various levels of experience. If you have a passion for embedding quality automation into the CI/CD, collaborating with highly skilled engineering's to shift quality to the left and get it right first time we want to talk to you. Why this job mattersThe QA Engineering independently executes a range of critical testing activities for a portfolio of products and services, driving best practice standards for test quality, resource planning and issue resolution, in alignment to business strategy and requirements. What you'll be doing Building automation test suites and executing them :60% coding and 40% collaborating with others Close collaboration with stakeholders to manage app releases for iOS and Android Actively participate in agile ceremonies, such as sprint planning and sprint reviews  Identify and collaborate on acceptance criteria for user stories Work with developers, Client and other testers to achieve the common goal of quality software  Develop and maintain test scenarios/test cases, sets of regression tests  Automation scripts creation and maintain software testing frameworks Contribute to testing process improvement efforts, focusing on test automation tools  Proactively report test results and blocking points to the stakeholders. Building automation for Flutter apps/API/Web. Working as team to code reviews, looking for the team to follow best practices. Skills and ExperienceEssential : Building automation QA processes on a mobile app from scratch Experienced in building mobile automation testing frameworks for native apps using tools like Appium, XCUI Test, XCTest, Espresso or similar Experienced with CI/CD tools e.g. gitlab Experienced with tools like Browserstack and WebdriverIO Comfortable working in agile cross-functional teams working closely with Developers and Product Managers Experience with JIRA tracking tool for documenting requirement, test cases and defect management  Strong background in testing concepts and QA best practices  Excellent oral and written communication skills Open to upskilling in front end frameworks and full stack development The candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of experience.Must Have: JS/TS experience. Cucumber Experience. Webdriver.io Experience. Cucumber Experience.Nice to have : API Testing using POSTMAN  Experienced in front end/UI automation e.g. Selenium, Cypress Flutter Mobile App Development Qualification BE

column2: Description : Job Description: Summary   :  The  Software QA Automation Engineer - Mobile App - Retail  is responsible for developing, executing automated test suites, and testing approaches throughout the SDLC from design, delivery, operations, and maintenance. This individual will collocate with the Development teams and Operations teams for ensuring overall code quality and ongoing maintenance and operations of a set of applications. Job Description: Participate in developing and documenting User Stories by providing the test strategy and automation estimates. Develop, document, and maintain the test strategy and test scenarios. Build and execute unit, component, acceptance, integration, load, security, scalability, usability, and platform tests. Conducts code reviews to ensure consistency, quality, and reusability of test automation artifacts. Partner with the developers to ensure all areas of the application are fully tested and to find technical solutions for test automation. Build and manage automated test suites and ensure execution through various environments, CI-CD pipelines and to be used by NOC teams. Regularly execute, maintain and upkeep automated test suites and analyse the results to identify the cause for failures. Create defects for issues found with appropriate details and ensure issues are resolved, including validation of the fix, and required automation updates. Present appropriate results to sign off on software functionality for new Production releases. Work with cross team impacts and release management to manage dev, QA, and production release of the software. Perform exploratory testing to understand the feature and how it is implemented, to find additional or unexClientted behaviour, and to refine and define additional test cases for the feature. Contribute to the QA automation framework using industry standard tools and approaches. Leverage and enhance coding standards and best practices for automated QA code. Participate in analysing Major Incidents and Emergency Change controls to identify opportunities to automate software quality test cases to reduce or eliminate those. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience. Minimum 7 years of industry experience, preferably in an Agile development environment. 5+ years' experience automating test cases for both native iOS and Android applications using Appium and a cloud device farm. Web/Mobile testing experience with Selenium, Appium using Java Experience in API automation testing using JAVA Springboot2, Rest Assured, GraphQL or Postman Experience with Appium, understanding of the WC3 protocol, WebDriverAgent and Mobile UI Automation tools such as XCUITest, UIAutomator2, etc. Ability to work independently with an aptitude for detailed work and follow-up activities. Ability to multitask in a fast-paced agile work environment. Experience in heavy traffic eCommerce applications

column2: Job Title:  Staff QA Engineer Location:  Pune, Ahmedabad, Bangalore Reports to:  Senior Manager, Quality Engineering A quick snapshot As Staff QA Engineer you will own product feature end to end from a test signoff standpoint in an Agile development environment. Your responsibilities will include designing, building robust, scalable, and high-quality test automation solutions for functional, regression, and feature testing. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics. These tests entail other tasks such as developing and running new tests and reporting their results to stakeholders, who will collaborate to fix program bugs or problems. Why its a big deal A Staff QA Engineer role has significance in the Testing Center of Excellence (TCoE) team at Conga, managing the production of test documents, the creation of test procedures, and ensuring high-quality products. Your expertise in agile methodology and automation tools will help in accelerating continuous enhancement of our product features, which is a big deal for us at Conga! Your extensive contribution to scrum teams in the implementation of automation footprints with a Sprint/Release will bring a high-quality impact on Conga?? products. Your collaboration with cross-functional teams ensures the smooth running of the QA department and ultimately customer satisfaction. Are you the person we??e looking for? Proven success in testing (Automation and Manual). Your experiences will include at least 8 years in developing/maintaining/customizing the automation framework to thrive excellence in testing and ensure extensive test coverage of the code/functionality. You have hands-on experience with test case planning, script development, maintenance, automation tools, frameworks, and developing automation scripts. Selenium and API . You have expertise with automation tools such as Selenium web driver, frameworks, and developing automation scripts using Java. Strong hands-on experience with API approach using Rest Assured or any such client. Hands-on with test management software such as QTest, JIRA, Jmeter, and Load Runner. Agile Methodology.  You are proficient with Agile and a collaborative cross-functional approach to building awesome software. You are comfortable working with teams and collaborating on best practices across multiple Agile teams. You constantly seek opinions and solicit feedback to create the best work possible. You don?? know any other way. It?? a team effort and you completely appreciate that. Strong experience in software testing lifecycle (STLC) and knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC). Education.  A bachelor?? degree in engineering or equivalent. Here?? what will give you an edge Strong attention to detail.  The Conga revenue lifecycle management solution showcases a wide variety of use cases, across multiple regions and languages. As a senior QA paying attention to the smallest details can help identify bugs that others might miss. Strong testing skills and logic based thinking is your forte. This is an absolute must. Your proven ability to analyze and apply logical thinking to determine the root cause of an issue is fundamental to success in this role. You can easily understand how systems interact/integrate with each other and as well as how changes in one application will affect others. Initiative . As senior professionals in QA, we need to own and initiate multiple things to make the quality better. Functional aspects, Non-functional aspects, Broader thinking, Integration approach, Reuse approach in Automation, Performance, Security, Database testing, and a lot more. Awareness . This role should be aware of the company vision, Goals, and Requirements, and work towards that direction to deliver quality so participation in multiple forums makes it more vital. Did we pique your interest? If this sounds like the kind of job you would love in the kind of environment where you would thrive, please click apply. We'd love to hear from you!

Your Role and Responsibilities As an Automation Testing Practitioner, you will design, build, test and deploy effective testing solutions which reduce the amount of manual effort in the testing process. You are responsible for applying automated tools in testing of applications across all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Support the test team by recommending tools and processes  To automate other test activities, such as test management, reporting, test data generation and defect management. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Knowledge of the commercial product ARIC from the Feature space will be an advantage Experience in MongoDB and WebServices testing is highly desired Ambitious individual who can work under their own direction towards agreed targets/goals.

Strong organizational and problem-solving skills with great attention to detail, critical thinking, solid communication, and proven leadership skills - with the ability to lead multiple test paths simultaneously. Knowledge in security testing, performance testing, performance tuning is a definite plus. Passion for achieving excellence in technical, process, product quality and reliability. Must be highly detail and technology-oriented and possess excellent communications skills. Expertise on API and BDD. Hands on experience on Manual and Automation API Testing tools. Experience in Test Strategy, Test Planning Hands on experience working on Automation Testing framework. Good Experience about software development to build and use automation frameworks using technologies: Java, Selenium, Cucumber, Soap UI, REST, JSON and XML, Eclipse IDE, etc. Experience in BDD (Cucumber), TestNG framework. Experience in Functional, Usability, Compatibility, Accessibility, Regression, Requirements / Documentation testing. Experience in test planning and estimations Experience in web application testing (JS, HTML, CSS) Knowledge of common tools/technologies used in testing: SQL, XML, JSON, Fiddler, Postman, HP ALM Experience in API Testing - Understanding of client-server architecture and communication principles Basic knowledge of SQL, UNIX - Knowledge of Selenium scripts, Jenkins is added advantage Experience working in Agile team. Good communication skills Will be a plus. Banking domain experience will be a plus.

column2: This position is for a skilled Software Engineer to join our NX Cloud QA Ecosystem Team. The role primarily involves collaborating with the NX Cloud Native Applications team to understand test requirements and priorities, focusing on enhancing the NX cloud testing infrastructure. The ideal candidate will excel in designing, developing, and maintaining automated testing frameworks while ensuring the stability and reliability of automation processes.             Key Responsibilities:           Collaborate with the NX Cloud Native Applications team to comprehend test needs, requirements, and priorities for various tests.     Automate image creation for cloud applications and provide support for distributed services.     Design, develop, and maintain automated testing frameworks for frontend and backend end-to-end application tests, applicable across multiple applications.     Write automated test samples within the designated test framework, focusing on aligning with business acceptance criteria.     Ensure the stability of automation processes and address issues related to flakiness.     Write clean and robust code to minimize the long-term cost of defects.     Participate in reviews of Requirements, Functional Specifications, Design Specifications, and Test Plans.           Required Core Skills:         Basic understanding of cloud-based programs.     Proficiency in writing Python/Perl-based testing tools.     Proficiency in JavaScript/NodeJS, or C++/Java.     Familiarity with BDD test frameworks such as Playwright, Puppeteer, Selenium, TestCafe, Jest, JUnit, etc     Knowledge of multiple frontend languages (eg, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, XML).     Hands-on experience with testing backend, mobile, and web applications.     Experience with mainstream Cloud platforms (eg, AWS, Azure, Tencent Cloud) is advantageous.     Familiarity with JIRA, GitLab is advantageous.     Knowledge of DevOps, Agile/SAFe methodologies is advantageous.     Exposure to NX technology is advantageous.         Required Secondary Skills:         Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.     Ability to collaborate effectively with team members across different time zones.     Proactive problem-solving skills.     Ability to multitask and work efficiently within time constraints.     Capability for independent work as well as collaborative development.     Eagerness to continuously improve and learn new areas.         Qualifications:    bachelors or masters degree in Engineering or equivalent

column2: Automation testing using Selenium with Java involves using Selenium WebDriver, a popular automation tool, along with Java programming language to automate web application testing. Here's an overview of how to perform automation testing with Selenium and Java: Setup Environment: Install Java Development Kit (JDK) on your system and set up Java environment variables. Download and install an Integrated Development Environment (IDE) like Eclipse or IntelliJ IDEA for Java development. Download Selenium WebDriver Java bindings and configure them in your project. Create a Maven Project (Optional): If you're using Maven as a build automation tool, create a Maven project and add dependencies for Selenium WebDriver and any additional libraries you'll need for testing. Write Test Scripts: Create Java classes to write test scripts using Selenium WebDriver API. Use WebDriver methods to interact with web elements such as buttons, links, input fields, and dropdowns. Write test assertions using TestNG or JUnit frameworks to verify expected outcomes and actual results. Implement Page Object Model (POM): Organize your test scripts using the Page Object Model (POM) design pattern to improve code maintainability and reusability. Create separate Java classes for each web page or component of your application, encapsulating the page-specific elements and actions within these classes. Handle Synchronization and Waits: Use implicit and explicit waits to handle synchronization issues and ensure that WebDriver waits for the expected conditions before performing actions on web elements. Implement waits for page loads, element visibility, element presence, and other asynchronous operations to avoid flakiness in test scripts. Implement Data-Driven Testing (Optional): Use data providers or external data sources (such as Excel sheets or CSV files) to parameterize your test scripts and execute them with different sets of test data. Implement data-driven testing to validate application behavior with various input combinations and edge cases. Execute Test Scripts: Run your Selenium test scripts locally on your development environment or integrate them with Continuous Integration (CI) servers like Jenkins, Bamboo, or Azure DevOps for automated test execution. Generate test reports using built-in reporting tools (TestNG, JUnit) or third-party reporting plugins (ExtentReports, Allure) to track test results and identify failures. Implement Cross-Browser Testing (Optional): Use Selenium Grid or cloud-based testing platforms (such as BrowserStack or Sauce Labs) to perform cross-browser testing across different web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, etc.). Write test scripts that are compatible with multiple browsers and handle browser-specific behaviors and capabilities. Implement Test Frameworks and Utilities (Optional): Use testing frameworks and utilities such as TestNG, JUnit, Apache POI (for Excel integration), Apache Commons IO (for file handling), and Log4j (for logging) to enhance the robustness and functionality of your test automation framework. Maintain Test Codebase: Regularly review and refactor test code to improve readability, maintainability, and performance. Update test scripts as needed to accommodate changes in application features, UI elements, or business requirements.

column2: We are seeking a skilled QA Engineer with expertise in both manual and automation testing to join our team. As a QA Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products by performing manual testing and developing automated test scripts. Your primary focus will be on creating test plans, executing tests, identifying and reporting bugs, and implementing test automation frameworks.     Responsibilities:       Collaborate with the development team and product managers to understand project requirements and user stories.         Develop test plans, test cases, and test scripts based on the requirements and functional specifications.         Execute manual test cases to verify the functionality, usability, and performance of the software.         Identify, record, and track defects using bug tracking tools and work with developers to resolve issues.         Develop and maintain automated test scripts using test automation frameworks and tools.         Conduct regression testing to ensure the stability and reliability of software releases.         Perform exploratory testing to identify potential issues and improve the overall quality of the software.         Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the software meets quality standards and customer expectations.         Continuously improve testing processes and techniques by staying updated with industry best practices.         Participate in code reviews and provide feedback to the development team on testability and quality aspects.         Document test results, defects, and test environments for future reference.         Work in an Agile development environment, actively participating in sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and other agile ceremonies.       Requirements       Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).         Proven experience as a QA Engineer, with a focus on both manual and automation testing.         Strong understanding of software testing concepts, methodologies, and best practices.         Proficient in creating test plans, test cases, and test scripts for manual testing.         Experience with test automation frameworks such as Selenium, Cypress, or Appium.         Knowledge of at least one programming language such as Java, C#, Python, or JavaScript.         Familiarity with API testing and tools like Postman or SOAPUI.         Experience with bug tracking tools such as JIRA or Bugzilla.         Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.         Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.         Excellent written and verbal communication skills.         Attention to detail and ability to prioritize tasks effectively.         ISTQB or other relevant certifications are a plus.
column11: Computer science, Test scripts, Analytical, Javascript, Regression testing, Selenium, Test cases, JIRA, Bugzilla, Python

Review quality metrics and advise on improvements.              Collaborate closely with Cross-functional Teams - local and remote test engineers.              Work closely with product management, design, support and development teams to deliver high-quality releases.                To be successful in this role, we need someone who has:                    Bachelors or Master Degree in computer science or relevant stream.              8+ years professional experience in Engineering/Quality Engineering including 2-3 years of tech lead/ team lead experience              Hands on experience in defining test strategies, test planning and test automation.              Experience working with a wide variety of automated testing frameworks such as JMeter, Selenium, TestNG, and other open-source projects. column2: Position Summary Experienced Senior Automation Tester  passionate about ensuring the delivery of high-quality software through the design, development, and execution of robust automated test suites. The ideal candidate should possesses a deep understanding of Selenium WebDriver, proven expertise in test automation frameworks, and a strong commitment to collaboration. Core Responsibilities Test Strategy:  Develop and execute comprehensive test automation strategies, ensuring alignment with project requirements and overall quality goals. Test Framework Design:  Design and maintain scalable, efficient, and reusable test automation frameworks using Selenium WebDriver and relevant programming languages (Java) Test Scripting:  Create well-structured, maintainable, and data-driven automated test scripts across functional, integration, regression, and performance testing areas. Continuous Integration:  Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins), enabling rapid feedback and early bug detection. Reporting & Analysis:   Track test case coverage, analyze test results, and provide clear reports to development and project teams. Mentorship:   Coach and mentor junior team members in best practices and emerging trends in test automation. Required Qualifications Experience:  5+ years of hands-on experience in software test automation, with a strong emphasis on Selenium WebDriver. Programming Skills:   Strong proficiency in one or more object-oriented programming languages (Java). Framework Expertise:   Proven experience in building and maintaining test automation frameworks (TestNG, JUnit, etc.). CI/CD Understanding:   Deep understanding of CI/CD concepts and expertise with tools like Jenkins, Azure DevOps, etc. Agile Methodology:   Experience working on Agile software development teams (Scrum, Kanban). Desired Skills API Testing:  Experience with API testing tools (Postman, Rest Assured, etc.)

He/she will be a critical part of the client's strategy to continue the path of transforming the products from a functional testing capability to an automated testing capability. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Designs, implements, operates, and maintains new and existing automated testing framework/s to support testing of front-end, API, database tiers across different browsers and devices. Develops, executes, maintains, and optimises automated tests based on existing, updated, and new manual test cases written by the functional testers. Provides clear and reliable reporting of automated test execution results and bugs to ensure delivery of reliable and scalable products to our customers. Performs and participates in code reviews to promote best practices in the test automation space. Works in conjunction with the Test Lead to create best practice assessments of the current level of testing methods, processes, standardisation; followed by the design, tailoring, consultation, implementation and standardisation of those methods and techniques across all future work. Applies knowledge of quality assurance and testing areas to define quality and test strategy. Creates and maintains the project quality plan and project test plan. Executes tests and provides updates to the project team to meet quality objectives. Performs self-based training in the upcoming technology, quality approaches, and testing techniques. Manages and maintains excellent and professional relationships with internal and external stakeholders and always provides excellent service and support. Effectively communicates and sets direction with clients. Champions in the implementation of new testing approaches or new technology. Prepares weekly and monthly regular reports of progress. Willing to take on new responsibilities as may be assigned by the management. REQUIRED COMPETENCIES: Strong working knowledge in Manual and Automation Testing using multiple testing tools and technical testing approaches. Proficient in automation, preferably in Playwright and?Selenium. column2: Diverse Lynx is looking for QA Automation Testing to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.As a QA Automation Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and executing automated test scripts to ensure the quality and reliability of software applications. Your role involves collaborating with cross-functional teams, creating test frameworks, and conducting automated testing throughout the software development lifecycle.      Responsibilities : Test Automation Development : Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts for web and mobile applications.Utilize automation tools and frameworks for efficient and scalable test automation.Test Planning and Strategy : Contribute to the development of test plans and strategies based on project requirements.Collaborate with stakeholders to understand application functionality and requirements.      Regression Testing : Conduct automated regression testing to ensure the stability of existing features after software changes or updates.Identify and automate critical and repetitive test scenarios.Integration Testing : Design and execute automated integration tests to verify the seamless interaction between different components of the application.      Defect Identification and Reporting : Identify, document, and report software defects in a clear and detailed manner.Collaborate with development teams to troubleshoot and resolve issues.Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) : Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines for continuous and reliable test execution.Collaborate with DevOps teams to align automated testing with deployment processes.      Performance Testing : Collaborate on the design and implementation of automated performance and load tests.Identify and report performance bottlenecks and areas for improvement.      Documentation : Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for test scripts, test frameworks, and testing processes.Document best practices for test automation and share knowledge with the team.Collaboration : Collaborate effectively with QA engineers, developers, and other stakeholders to ensure comprehensive test coverage.Participate in sprint planning, retrospectives, and other team activities.Stay Current with Industry Trends : Stay informed about the latest trends, tools, and methodologies in QA automation and software testing.Implement new technologies and approaches to enhance the efficiency of automated testing.

column2: Job Summary The Lead QA Engineer will report directly to the Director of Product Development and participate in all aspects of application requirements. You will report the failure and success of each test cases and be responsible to articulate and summarize the issues. Additionally, this role requires the ability to understand, learn and master the complex business rules underpinning our unique offering. You will work alongside other teams, collaborating on the various layers of the business processes within our Platform.  Responsibilities  This role will be responsible for the following:  Document testing strategy and approach.  Prepare test plans, test cases and scenarios to ensure effective testing coverage for the new development.  Execute functional, and UI based test cases, both black box and white box levels  Perform Regression Testing for existing and new functionality  Work closely with Development, Product Management and QA Testing team to develop an applicable test approach and strategy for Web, Mobile and FAST applications  Triage on-going production issues reported by the Concierge team and keep track of the open issues.  Log and track defects using the Jira tools  Automation of FAST application testing  Reporting and documenting the test results for each sprint/test cycles  Improve the testing process by implementing the standard testing processes.  Ability to work in fast pace development environment with multiple priorities  Skills/Competencies  To apply for this position, you must have the following skills and competencies. Items marked as  preferred  represent skills  not required  but preferred to have.  Experience 8+ years of Quality Assurance experience with Automation Solid knowledge of mobile and web application testing processes with Mobile Automation.  Strong understanding of mobile application platforms and technologies  Experience creating and maintaining test scripts Hands-on experience with NoSQL database and N1QL (SQL for JSON) query language. Hands-on experience with Jira and Automated testing tools.  Hands-on experience with Data Warehouse and backend testing using SQL and files.  Hand-on experience with API and UI automation like selenium python, pytest, and API preferred, but experience with other coding skills and willing to transform.  Hand-on experience with Unix commands to verify issues in server logs.  Demonstrated command and experience working with Test and Defect Management/Workflow tools  Experience in software and system performance, load and stress testing required Working knowledge of cloud-based applications, SQL, and Windows GUI Knowledge of Insurance, Healthcare, and  Pharma domain is a plus Strong analytical skills and decision-making capabilities.  Understanding of Agile/Scrum/DevOps development methodology  Comprehensive understanding of test methodologies and techniques  Familiarity with Software Development Life cycle (SDLC) and testing process

The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes.     Key Responsibilities: Design, develop, and execute testing of the applications. Develop and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases based on functional and non-functional requirements. Identify, record, document thoroughly, and track bugs. Conduct thorough regression testing to ensure the stability of new features and enhancements. Liaise with internal teams (e.g., developers and product managers) to identify system requirements. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to communicate test results, prioritize issues, and drive timely resolutions. Document and track defects using issue-tracking tools, and participate in defect triage meetings. Monitor debugging process results. Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies. Understand the product and draft manual of the application we develop.     Qualifications: Any qualification in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Proven work experience in software quality assurance. Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes. Experience in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases. Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing. Hands-on experience with automated testing tools. Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process.

column2: Title: Automation Test Lead Job Description: Overview:  We are seeking an experienced Automation Test Lead with a strong background in API testing and automation using tools such as Rest Assured. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional leadership skills to guide and mentor a team of testers, along with excellent communication abilities to effectively engage with stakeholders. This role requires proficiency in API testing methodologies, automation frameworks, and a proactive approach to driving quality assurance initiatives within the organization. Key Responsibilities: API Testing Expertise:  Demonstrate proficiency in API testing techniques, including but not limited to functional testing, performance testing, and security testing. Utilize tools like Rest Assured to design, develop, and execute robust test cases for APIs. Automation Framework Development:  Lead the design and implementation of automation frameworks for API testing, ensuring scalability, maintainability, and efficiency. Drive the adoption of best practices and standards across the automation testing process. Team Leadership:  Provide guidance, mentorship, and support to a team of automation testers. Define project goals, assign tasks, and monitor progress to ensure timely delivery of high-quality automation solutions. Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture. Stakeholder Communication:  Act as a liaison between the testing team and stakeholders, including project managers, developers, and business analysts. Communicate project status, risks, and issues effectively, and address stakeholder feedback to align testing efforts with business objectives. Continuous Improvement:  Champion continuous improvement initiatives within the testing team, driving innovation and efficiency enhancements in testing processes, tools, and methodologies. Encourage a culture of learning and knowledge sharing. Quality Assurance Governance:  Establish and enforce quality assurance standards, policies, and procedures across projects. Conduct regular reviews of testing deliverables to ensure compliance with established guidelines and industry best practices. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Proven experience in API testing and automation, with expertise in tools such as Rest Assured. Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire team members to achieve project goals. Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities, with a track record of effectively engaging with diverse stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Solid understanding of software testing principles, methodologies, and best practices. Experience in Agile development methodologies and working in cross-functional teams. Certifications in software testing (e.g., ISTQB) and/or leadership (e.g., PMP) are a plus.

column2: Automated Test Script Development: Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts and test frameworks using C# and Selenium to ensure comprehensive test coverage and efficient testing processes.     Test Data Management: Collaborate with the development team and stakeholders to identify test data requirements, create and manage test data sets, and ensure data integrity for accurate test results.     Test Execution and Analysis: Execute automated test scripts, analyze test results, and report defects. Work closely with the development team to troubleshoot issues and verify bug fixes.     Continuous Integration: Integrate automated test suites into the continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline to enable faster and more reliable software releases.     Test Environment Management: Set up and maintain test environments, ensuring they are consistent and representative of production environments.     Regression Testing: Perform regular regression testing to identify and prevent software regressions and ensure product stability over time.     Test Documentation: Create and maintain test documentation, including test plans, test cases, and test reports.     Test Automation Best Practices: Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging tools and technologies in test automation to continuously improve the testing process and efficiency.         Requirements:         Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.     Experience: Proven experience in automation testing using C# and Selenium, along with a strong understanding of SQL databases.     Programming Skills: Proficient in C# programming language, with the ability to develop and maintain automation test scripts.     Selenium: Hands-on experience with Selenium WebDriver and related tools for web application testing.     SQL: Strong knowledge of SQL and database concepts for data verification and validation.     Test Automation Frameworks: Familiarity with various test automation frameworks, such as NUnit, TestNG, or MSTest.     CI/CD: Experience with continuous integration and continuous delivery tools, such as Jenkins, Azure DevOps, or TeamCity.     Problem-solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and troubleshoot issues in the software.     Communication: Excellent communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and effectively report test results.     Agile Methodology: Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and working in an Agile team.     Attention to Detail: Strong attention to detail to ensure comprehensive testing and accurate defect reporting.     Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changing requirements and work effectively in a fast-paced environment.

column2: A Test Automation Lead is a crucial role in software development, especially in environments where automated testing is a significant part of the quality assurance process. He must have 9 -12 years of hands-on e  xperience in Web, Mobile and API automation using Selenium/Cypress, Appium and RestAssured with Java.  He should have expertise in developing automation framework, automation strategy, RFP support, working on POCs and client presentations. Heres an outline of what this role typically involves:  	??Automation Strategy: Developing and implementing an automation strategy aligned with the overall testing and development strategy of the organization. This includes selecting appropriate automation tools, frameworks, and technologies.  	??Automation Framework Development: Designing and developing automation frameworks that can be used across different projects and teams. This involves creating reusable components, libraries, and utilities to support automated testing efforts.  	??Test Automation: Writing and maintaining automated test scripts for functional, regression, performance, and other types of testing. This may involve using tools like Selenium, Appium, JUnit, TestNG, or custom-built frameworks.  	??Integration with CI/CD: Integrating automated tests into continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to ensure that tests are run automatically as part of the build and deployment process.  	??Collaboration and Communication: Collaborating with development teams, QA teams, and other stakeholders to ensure that automation efforts are aligned with project goals. Communicating automation progress, results, and issues effectively. Provide leadership and guidance to the QA team, fostering a collaborative and high-performance work environment. Collaborate with project managers, business analysts, and development teams to create comprehensive test plans.  	??Quality Assurance: Ensuring that automated tests are comprehensive, reliable, and maintainable. Monitoring test results, analyzing failures, and troubleshooting automation issues.  Training and Mentoring: Providing guidance, training, and mentoring to other team members on automation  Continuous Improvement: Identifying areas for automation improvement, optimizing existing automation frameworks, and staying updated with emerging trends and technologies in test automation.
column11: Rest Assured, Cypress, Automation Framework, Appium, Selenium, C Selenium, Api Automation, Mobile Automation, Typescript, SDET, Javascript, Java Selenium

column2: Project Role : Quality Engineer (Tester) Project Role Description : Enables full stack solutions through multi-disciplinary team planning and ecosystem integration to accelerate delivery and drive quality across the application lifecycle. Performs continuous testing for security, API, and regression suite. Creates automation strategy, automated scripts and supports data and environment configuration. Participates in code reviews, monitors, and reports defects to support continuous improvement activities for the end-to-end testing process.  Must have skills : Automated Testing Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : 15 full years of education and necessarily degree in engineering  Summary :As a Quality Engineer (Tester), you will be responsible for enabling full stack solutions through multi-disciplinary team planning and ecosystem integration to accelerate delivery and drive quality across the application lifecycle. Your typical day will involve performing continuous testing for security, API, and regression suite, creating automation strategy, automated scripts and supporting data and environment configuration, participating in code reviews, monitoring, and reporting defects to support continuous improvement activities for the end-to-end testing process.  Roles & Responsibilities: Develop and execute automated test scripts using Selenium, Appium, and other automation tools. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize test cases for automation. Design and implement test automation frameworks to support continuous integration and delivery. Perform manual testing as needed to ensure comprehensive test coverage. Identify and report defects, and work with development teams to resolve issues. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Experience in API TestingExperience in automated testing using Selenium, Appium, or similar tools. Must To Have Skills:Strong understanding of software testing methodologies and best practices. Good To Have Skills:Experience with test automation frameworks such as TestNG, JUnit, or NUnit. Good To Have Skills:Experience with continuous integration and delivery tools such as Jenkins or Bamboo. Good To Have Skills:Knowledge of programming languages such as Java, Python, or C#. Good To Have Skills:Experience with API testing using tools such as Postman or SoapUI. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in automated testing. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering high-quality software. This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification 15 full years of education and necessarily degree in engineering

column2: Automation testing using Selenium with Java involves using Selenium WebDriver, a popular automation tool, along with Java programming language to automate web application testing. Here's an overview of how to perform automation testing with Selenium and Java: Setup Environment: Install Java Development Kit (JDK) on your system and set up Java environment variables. Download and install an Integrated Development Environment (IDE) like Eclipse or IntelliJ IDEA for Java development. Download Selenium WebDriver Java bindings and configure them in your project. Create a Maven Project (Optional): If you're using Maven as a build automation tool, create a Maven project and add dependencies for Selenium WebDriver and any additional libraries you'll need for testing. Write Test Scripts: Create Java classes to write test scripts using Selenium WebDriver API. Use WebDriver methods to interact with web elements such as buttons, links, input fields, and dropdowns. Write test assertions using TestNG or JUnit frameworks to verify expected outcomes and actual results. Implement Page Object Model (POM): Organize your test scripts using the Page Object Model (POM) design pattern to improve code maintainability and reusability. Create separate Java classes for each web page or component of your application, encapsulating the page-specific elements and actions within these classes. Handle Synchronization and Waits: Use implicit and explicit waits to handle synchronization issues and ensure that WebDriver waits for the expected conditions before performing actions on web elements. Implement waits for page loads, element visibility, element presence, and other asynchronous operations to avoid flakiness in test scripts. Implement Data-Driven Testing (Optional): Use data providers or external data sources (such as Excel sheets or CSV files) to parameterize your test scripts and execute them with different sets of test data. Implement data-driven testing to validate application behavior with various input combinations and edge cases. Execute Test Scripts: Run your Selenium test scripts locally on your development environment or integrate them with Continuous Integration (CI) servers like Jenkins, Bamboo, or Azure DevOps for automated test execution. Generate test reports using built-in reporting tools (TestNG, JUnit) or third-party reporting plugins (ExtentReports, Allure) to track test results and identify failures. Implement Cross-Browser Testing (Optional): Use Selenium Grid or cloud-based testing platforms (such as BrowserStack or Sauce Labs) to perform cross-browser testing across different web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, etc.). Write test scripts that are compatible with multiple browsers and handle browser-specific behaviors and capabilities. Implement Test Frameworks and Utilities (Optional): Use testing frameworks and utilities such as TestNG, JUnit, Apache POI (for Excel integration), Apache Commons IO (for file handling), and Log4j (for logging) to enhance the robustness and functionality of your test automation framework. Maintain Test Codebase: Regularly review and refactor test code to improve readability, maintainability, and performance. Update test scripts as needed to accommodate changes in application features, UI elements, or business requirements.
column11: Automation Testing, Apache POI, Jenkins, Java, JUnit, TestNG, Selenium, Bamboo, Azure DevOps

column2: Job Description : Our team are responsible for the development and maintenance of multiple systems across the Globe. We pride ourselves on fostering a collaborative and challenging work environment that encourages professional growth and creativity. We are currently seeking a QA Lead. We are cloud native in our approach, seeking to leverage Managed Services where possible, enabling our developers to remain laser focused on delivering business value. The product that we are developing will require the adoption of appropriate, and best practice technologies to ensure we maximize value for our employees. Role: As a Automation Tester, you will play a role within our Product Engineering team, responsible for designing, implementing, and executing comprehensive test strategies. Your expertise will be crucial in guaranteeing quality, performance, and reliability of our software products. If you are passionate about test automation and thrive in a collaborative, innovative environment, we want to hear from you. Delivery of Quality is a must, and you will pride yourself not only on your code but all aspects of your work. Develop and implement test strategies that align with product requirements and ensure comprehensive test coverage. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements, goals and to define testing milestones. Design, develop, and execute automated test cases to verify software functionality and performance. Perform exploratory testing where required, whilst seeking to automate all use cases. Conduct thorough regression testing to ensure the stability of software releases. Leverage automation tools and frameworks to streamline repetitive testing tasks and improve efficiency. Work on the continuous improvement of test automation practices and frameworks. Investigate, analyse, and document software defects, working closely with development teams to facilitate timely resolutions. Provide detailed and actionable feedback to development teams to enhance product quality. Collaborate with software engineers, product managers, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and deliver high-quality products. Participate in cross-functional team meetings to contribute to the overall development and testing process. Provide guidance and mentorship to junior test engineers. Lead by example, promoting a culture of quality and continuous improvement within the testing team. Interpersonal and Non-Technical Skills Excellent interpersonal skills, verbal and written communication skills when working with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Ability to articulate arguments well and is comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders. A strong natural focus on what matters; delivering value and designing to minimise risk. Hands-on experience of working through the end-to-end project lifecycle within an Agile environment. The ability to work across multiple priorities in parallel and the ability to contribute to wider group strategies. Ability to work alone or collaboratively with minimal supervision. Technical Skills: Should have experience in Automation using  Selenium,Java  , Cucumber and Rest API. Should have hands-on experience in  Automation using Selenium with Java. Good knowledge of testing salesforce implementation projects in Salesforce (Classic/Lightning) End to End testing. Should have experience in working in a team in an agile environment. Good to have hands-on experience in BDD/Cucumber.. Good to have technical exposure in API/Web-services testing using Postman and Rest Assured. Be able to work on both manual and automation testing. Good to have any salesforce certification Should have good knowledge of Test management tools like Jira, Zephyre etc. Hands-on experience with performance testing [a big plus] Strong technical skills, both functional and non-functional, manual and automation, ideally in a continuous delivery environment. A self-motivated and enthusiastic professional who is a self-path-maker. Excellent communicator, should be able to represent his/her work in daily meetings within the team or with clients.

column2: QA Automation Engineer with strong scripting / programming skills and proficient in automation tools like QTP / UFT. Good knowledge of Automation framework. Should have been involved in end to end automation framework development.       Should have good knowledge of ALM 12.0 modules like Test Plan, Test Lab, Test Management and Dashboard.         Should have knowledge of creating queries in Oracle PL/SQL.       Work closely with functional BAs to understand the functional flow of new/modified functionality and then write functional test cases.     As and when required, person should be open to help manual testing team also in performing manual testing.     Participate in critical analysis, design, and change review meetings for software developed in-house, by outside third parties, as part of packaged, commercial, off-the-shelf application platforms or Software-as-a-Service platforms that may be modified or configured to suit project and business requirements.     Serve as QA Testing Team leader for specific projects or products, overseeing and administering work assignments and results of an extended onsite/offsite team ensuring appropriate allocation and coverage to satisfy and ensure quality delivery.         Designs automated scripts to perform compliance testing and validate web and mobile applications while both reducing test time and increasing test coverage.     Executes functional level tests on software products to ensure that customer requirements are being met.     Along with feature and functional automation, designs automated scripts to perform compliance testing, as well as web and mobile application validation, while reducing test time and increasing test coverage.     Collaborates with various engineering teams to gather requirements, prototypes, wireframes, user journeys, and product roadmaps to share with the Quality Assurance (QA) Automation Team.     Develops and delivers test plans, lab reports and technical presentations to key management and engineering stakeholders.     Utilizes various automation tools such as UFT to increase engineering efficiency.     Consistently monitors and improves automation scripts to mitigate issues, reduce time to market, reduce use of production data, and to improve the value of QA testing to the organization.     Identifies all automation processes associated with current and future Arvest applications and recommends appropriate automation frameworks and solutions to IT QA management.     Explains procedures to new team members, coaching them through problem resolution.     Trains and develops other team members to meet both current and future resource requirements, and communicates to them, via regular team and one-on-one meetings, IT, and organizational changes         OPTIONAL FUNCTIONS   :       Experience in performance testing (load runner) will be an added advantage.     Experience in Appium - Mobile automation or Selenium will be added advantage.         EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:         Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or a related field of study or equivalent combination of technical education and work experience required.     5-7 years relevant experience in QA Automation required. Experience with Microsoft, Java and / or UNIX platforms or applications environment highly desirable. Experience in tower business, operations, leasing and/or real estate a plus but not required.      Ability to automate test cases using UFT automation tools for a Minimum of 2 years.

As a Cloud Certified Automation Resource, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining automated solutions for cloud-based infrastructure and services     Your role will involve utilizing cloud-native tools and scripting languages to streamline processes, enhance efficiency, and ensure the scalability of cloud environments         Key Responsibilities         Cloud Automation:Design and implement automation solutions for provisioning, configuration, and management of cloud resources     Utilize cloud-native tools and services for automation purposes     Scripting and Coding:Develop scripts and code using languages such as Python, PowerShell, or other scripting languages     Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) practices for cloud resources Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD):Implement CI/CD pipelines for cloud-based applications and infrastructure     Automate testing, deployment, and rollback processes     Configuration Management:Implement configuration management solutions to ensure consistency and compliance across cloud environments     Utilize tools like Ansible, Puppet, or Chef for configuration automation Logging Automation:Automate monitoring and logging configurations for cloud services     Implement automated responses to detected issues     Collaboration and Documentation:Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, operations, and security     Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for automation scripts and processes     Cloud Certification Compliance:Ensure that automation practices align with cloud provider certification requirements     Stay updated on the latest certifications and best practices for cloud automation

column2: At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive.                  We re making this happen by improving our customers financial wellbeing so they can achieve incredible things - be it buying their home, building a business or saving for things big or small.                          We are seeking a Test Engineer to join ANZ s Customer Banker Platforms Team to play a key part in contributing to change initiatives across ANZs Customer Banker Platforms Applications.               About You                     As a Test Engineer with ANZ s Customer Banker Platforms Team, you will bring the following skills experiences;                       Experience in designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining Java application phases, code, and software (Java 8+, Spring Boot)                     You will have experience working with Rest APIs, development and integration using REST/JSON, Kafka, message queues                     Proven experience designing, developing and maintaining test automation scripts and stubbing frameworks as a Test Engineer                     Proven experience with test automation tools/frameworks, (e.g. RestAssured, Concordion, Wiremock, Selenium/Webdriver etc.)                     Sound experience in documenting test cases and executing testing for various projects, initiatives and BAU tasks, ensuring that high quality and effective test planning and execution is conducted                     Experience with CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins)                     Technical knowledge and understanding of relational databases, web services, messaging and stubbing Experience with QA Review process using source control tools (e.g. GitHub, BitBucket, etc.) Good understanding and knowledge of microservices.                     Experience of developing and testing Microservices / APIs.                     Scrum/Agile experience preferred but not essential.                     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Self-managing and a self-starter.                     Comfortable in switching hats from Developer to Tester as required. The role is 50% Developer and 50% Tester                     What will your day look like                     In this role, you will have the opportunity to:                       Be part of a cross-functional team working collaboratively within high-performing Agile teams.                     Develop and Maintain APIs, also contribute in tackling Technical Debt / Platform Health activities.                     Develop test cases and execute testing for various projects, initiatives, and BAU tasks.                     Ensure that high quality and effective test planning and execution are conducted in accordance with ANZ standards.                      Contribute to the Automation testing framework of the unit.                     Collaborate with developers and other colleagues to improve the quality of our products throughout the whole feature delivery cycle.                     Identify testing bottlenecks and make improvements to accelerate delivery with high confidence.                     Conduct both manual and automated tests, analyse bugs found during tests and document test results for feature delivery.                     You will be passionate about driving change and improvements in Development, writing code, test automation and the continuous delivery spaces, improving software quality, delivering software faster and more reliably.                       Skills                       Desirable Skills Experience:                         Experience with BDD or Specification by Example                     Containerisation and DevOps knowledge (e.g. AWS Cloud, Docker, Openshift)                      Linux
